proclino: <entryFree id="n38475" type="main" key="pro_cli_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-clīno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">incline forwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incline</hi> (not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n38475.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum mare in haec magnus proclinet litora Nereus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:11:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 11, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curvatura montis proclinata ad mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proclinatum latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38475.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in <hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclining</hi> or <hi rend="ital">verging to a consummation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tottering to its fall</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjuvat rem proclinatam Convictolitanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 42, 2</bibl></cit>: proclinatā jam re, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8</bibl>, B, § 1.</sense></entryFree>
proclive: <entryFree id="n38476" type="main" key="pro_cli_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōclīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. proclivis <sense id="n38476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
proclivis: <entryFree id="n38477" type="main" key="pro_cli_vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōclīvis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (ante- and post-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōclīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 270</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:2:2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 2, 2</bibl>; v. Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 91), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>proclivus</etym>, <sense id="n38477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sloping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">going downwards</hi> or <hi rend="ital">downhill.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38477.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Cæs.: solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per proclivem viam duci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 30</bibl></cit>: omnia procliva sunt; <cit><quote lang="la">facile descenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apoc. 13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Apoc. 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-clīve</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōclīvum</orth>, i), <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a slope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">descent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declivity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelli per proclive,</quote> <trans><tr>downhill</tr>, <tr>downwards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 43, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjuvante proclivo impetum militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:2:2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit> (al. proclivio): <cit><quote lang="la">in proclive detrudi, Auct. B. Alex. 76: per proclivia devolare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:5:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of persons, <hi rend="ital">going downwards</hi> or <hi rend="ital">downhill</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Honor. 178</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38477.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38477.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Downwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">descending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">downhill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declining</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">proclivi cursu et facili delabi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:28:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 28, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam proclivi senectute,</quote> <trans><tr>declining</tr>, <tr>drawing to a close</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Fl. 4, p. 361</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Junius mensis est jam proclivus in Julium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86, 16</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">proclivi currit oratio,</quote> <trans><tr>flows precipitately</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 84</bibl></cit>; v. Madv. ad h. l.—</sense><sense id="n38477.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Inclined</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disposed</hi> to a thing, <hi rend="ital">liable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subject; ready</hi>, <hi rend="ital">willing</hi> (freq. and class.; mostly in a bad sense; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:12:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 12, 27</bibl>, s. v. proclivitas; syn. propensus); constr. usually <hi rend="ital">ad aliquid</hi>, more rarely with <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">circa.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38477.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium Hominum proclive ad lubidinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquem morbum proclivior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:37:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 37, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo et invidi et malevoli...quia proclives ad eas perturbationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitia debet esse ad omnem comitatem facilitatemque proclivior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 18, 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38477.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">sceleri proclivis egestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:585" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 585</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38477.7" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">circa</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">eritque judex circa modestiam juris probatione proclivior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38477.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Steep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsafe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untrustworthy;</hi> and hence, <hi rend="ital">obscure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unintelligible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecisti modo mi ex proclivo planum,</quote> <trans><tr>you make it plain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciam hanc rem planam ex proclivā tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam iste proclive'st quod jubes me plane conlocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38477.9" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">easy</hi> to be done: <cit><quote lang="la">proclivia anteponuntur laboriosis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:18:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 18, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa facilia, proclivia, jucunda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 27, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut fingendi proclivis esset ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proclivus impetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:728" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 728</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum proclivior faciliorque jactus sit ex supernis in infima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:1:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictu quidem est proclive,</quote> <trans><tr>easy to be said</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:20:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 20, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod est multo proclivius,</quote> <trans><tr>much easier</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: in proclivi, <hi rend="ital">easy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam hoc quidem tibi in proclivi, quam imber est, quando pluit,</quote> <trans><tr>as easy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id. faciam, in proclivi quod est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia omnia in proclivi erunt,</quote> <trans><tr>will be easy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Or. ad Caes. 2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Or. ad Caes. 2, 8</bibl></cit>; v. planum.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in two forms, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōclīvē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-clīvĭter</orth> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:24" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 4</bibl>). <cb n="PROC" /> </sense><sense id="n38477.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Downwards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proclive labuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>rush downwards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:18:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 18, 42</bibl></cit> Kühn. and Moser <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (B. and K. proclivi); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:455" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 455</bibl> Lachm.; cf. sublime ferri, under sublimis.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">labi verba proclivius,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>more rapidly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:57:191" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 57, 191</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quin proclivius hic iras decurrat ad acris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 311</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38477.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Easily</hi>: facile et procliviter persuadere, Castric. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:6:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 6, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo proclivius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:792" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 792</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proclivitas: <entryFree id="n38478" type="main" key="pro_cli_vi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōclīvĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>proclivis</etym>. <sense id="n38478.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A steep descent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declivity</hi> (post-class.): parvulam proclivitatem digressus, Auct. B. Afr. 37.—</sense><sense id="n38478.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tendency</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proneness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propensity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclivity</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad morbos proclivitas...proclivitas ad suum quodque genus, ad aegrotandum proclivitas. Sed haec in bonis rebus facilitas nominetur, in malis proclivitas, ut significet lapsionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:12:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 12, 27</bibl></cit> and 28.</sense></entryFree>
procliviter: <entryFree id="n38479" type="main" key="pro_cli_vi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōclīvĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. proclivis <sense id="n38479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
proclivium: <entryFree id="n38480" type="spur" key="pro_cli_vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōclīvĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, a false read. for proclivo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:2:2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 2, 2</bibl>; v. proclivis.</entryFree>
proclivus: <entryFree id="n38481" type="main" key="pro_cli_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōclīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. proclivis <sense id="n38481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
procludo: <entryFree id="n38482" type="main" key="pro_clu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-clūdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shut up</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 26</bibl> (al. praecludat).</sense></entryFree>
procne: <entryFree id="n38483" type="main" key="Procne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Procnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, v. Progne.</entryFree>
proco: <entryFree id="n38484" type="main" key="pro^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏcor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>cf. precor</etym>, <sense id="n38484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to ask</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demand</hi> (very rare): parere mea vos majestas procat, Liv. And. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 24, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a procando, id est poscendo, procacitas nominata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:6:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 6, 6</bibl></cit> (ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 24, 3</bibl>): procare, poscere, unde procaces meretrices ab assidue poscendo, et proci uxorem poscentes in matrimonium, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=224" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 224</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">poscere procare dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=80" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 80</bibl></cit> ib.: <cit><quote lang="la">perit, inquit, procari, si latet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4</bibl></cit>, praef. 5.</sense></entryFree>
procoeton: <entryFree id="n38485" type="greek" key="pro^coeton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏcoeton</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">prokoitw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n38485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an anteroom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">antechamber</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 10</bibl> and 23 (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2</bibl>, prooem. § 2, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
procomion: <entryFree id="n38486" type="greek" key="proco^mi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">procŏmĭon</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">proko/mion</foreign>, <sense id="n38486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the hair on the front part of the head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the front hair</hi> (pure Lat. antiae), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 11, 4</bibl> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (al. protocomia).</sense></entryFree>
proconnesus: <entryFree id="n38487" type="main" key="Pro^conne_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏconnēsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*proko/nnhsos</foreign>, <sense id="n38487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Propontis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abounding in wine and marble</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Marmora</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 44, § 151</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n38487.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏ-connensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Proconnessus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Proconnessian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 37 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n38487.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏconnēsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Proconnessian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 11, 9, § 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 6, 6, § 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:185" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 10, 70, § 185</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proconsul: <entryFree id="n38488" type="main" key="pro_consul"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-consul</orth> (also separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prō consŭle</orth>; v. pro, II. B. 2.; and abbreviated, procos.), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n38488.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who at the close of his consulship in Rome became governor of a province</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">military commander under a governor; a proconsul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:36:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 36, 76</bibl>: Domitium proconsulem arcessivit, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 902</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">agendas pro praetoribus, prove consulibus grates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Manilius Procos.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38488.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">an ex-prœtor made governor of a province</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Gellius) cum pro consule ex praeturā in Graeciam venisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:20:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 20, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 46</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n38488.2" n="2" level="3"> = propraetor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 29, 4</bibl> Weissenb. ad loc.; 33, 25, 9; 35, 22, 6 al.—</sense><sense id="n38488.3" n="II" level="1"> Under the emperors, who shared the provinces with the Senate, <hi rend="ital">a governor in one of the provinces of the Senate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:139" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 139</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38488.4" n="B" level="2"> Of <hi rend="ital">municipal officers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:19:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 19, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proconsularis: <entryFree id="n38489" type="main" key="pro_consu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōconsŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>proconsul</etym>, <sense id="n38489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a proconsul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proconsular</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">proconsularis vir,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>a proconsul</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 42</bibl></cit>: imago, <hi rend="ital">of the military tribuneship</hi>, which was in the place of a consulate, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:14:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 14, 17</bibl></cit>: PROVINCIA, of <hi rend="ital">Africa</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 361, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proconsulatus: <entryFree id="n38490" type="main" key="pro_consu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōconsŭlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n38490.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The dignity</hi> or <hi rend="ital">office of a proconsul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a proconsulship</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 2</bibl> et mult. al.— </sense><sense id="n38490.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A proprœtorship</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
procor: <entryFree id="n38491" type="main" key="pro^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏcor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, v. proco.</entryFree>
procrastinatio: <entryFree id="n38492" type="greek" key="pro_crasti^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcrastĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>procrastino</etym>, <sense id="n38492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a putting off to the morrow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from day to day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procrastination</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tarditas et procrastinatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
procrastino: <entryFree id="n38493" type="main" key="pro_crasti^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcrastĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pro crastinus</etym>, <sense id="n38493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put off till the morrow</hi>, <pb n="1453" /> <cb n="PROC" /> hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to put off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procrastinate</hi> (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">differo): rem differre cotidie ac procrastinare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 9, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Amic. 2:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Amic. 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl> Mai.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res non procrastinatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:45:section=100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 45, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae procrastinata sunt ab eo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:10:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 10, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
procreabilis: <entryFree id="n38494" type="main" key="pro_cre^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcrĕābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>procreo</etym>, <sense id="n38494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to generation</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">sacramentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 2, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
procreatio: <entryFree id="n38495" type="main" key="pro_cre^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcrĕātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a begetting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procreation</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">procreatio liberorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:14:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum procreationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:46:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 46, 96</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38495.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that which is begotten</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
procreator: <entryFree id="n38496" type="main" key="pro_cre^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcrĕātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a begetter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">producer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">creator</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ille procreator mundi deus,</quote> <trans><tr>author</tr>, <tr>creator</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:8:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a procreatoribus amari,</quote> <trans><tr>by one's parents</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:7:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 7, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 23, 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
procreatrix: <entryFree id="n38497" type="main" key="pro_cre^a_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcrĕātrix</orth>, <itype>Icis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>procreator</etym>, <sense id="n38497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that brings forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a mother</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">philosophia artium procreatrix quaedam et quasi parens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; Auct. Pervig. Ven. 64.</sense></entryFree>
procreo: <entryFree id="n38498" type="main" key="pro_cre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-crĕo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beget</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procreate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38498.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">procreare liberos lepidum est onus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multiplices fetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:5:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 5, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de matrefamilias duo filios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:19:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 19, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberos ex tribus uxoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Reg. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc solum, in quo tu ortus et procreatus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:19:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 19, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:26:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 26, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura hinc sensus animantum procreat omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:880" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 880</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra ex minutissimis seminibus tantos truncos ramosque procreat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38498.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occasion</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">usum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:835" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 835</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunatus, cujus primum ortum inter arma civium procreatum videmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus verbum est: Leges bonae ex malis moribus procreantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
procresco: <entryFree id="n38499" type="main" key="pro_cresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-cresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <sense id="n38499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38499.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To grow forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spring up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quattuor ex rebus posse omnia procrescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 715</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38499.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis morbi procrescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:664" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 664</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38499.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To continue to grow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grow larger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n38499.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">res progigni et genitas procrescere posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 566</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n38499.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (amor) si officiorum ratione coleretur, non ultra myrtos laurusque procresceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 1, 2</bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
procris: <entryFree id="n38500" type="main" key="Procris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Procris</orth>, <itype>is and ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pro/kris</foreign>, <sense id="n38500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a daughter of the Athenian king Erechtheus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wife of Cephalus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who shot her in a wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mistaking her for a wild beast</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:707 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 707 sq.</bibl>, and 795 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 727</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Procrim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 445</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
procrustes: <entryFree id="n38501" type="main" key="Pro^crustes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏcrustes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*prokrou/sths</foreign>, <sense id="n38501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a noted highwayman in Attica. He had a bed upon which he compelled travellers to lie down; when they were longer than the bed he cut off as much of their limbs as would suffice to make the length equal; and when they were shorter he stretched them out to its length. He was slain by Theseus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidit et immitem Cephisias ora Procrusten,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 438</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torvus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 2:4:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 2, 4, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 38" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
procubitores: <entryFree id="n38502" type="gloss" key="pro_cu^bi^to_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcŭbĭtōres</orth> <itype>dicuntur fere velites, qui noctu custodiae causā ante castra excubant, cum castra hostium in propinquo sunt</itype>, ut M. Cato in eo, quem de re militari scripsit, <sense id="n38502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the night-watch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=253" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 253</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
procubo: <entryFree id="n38503" type="main" key="pro_cu^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-cŭbo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n38503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lie stretched out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lie along</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi saxea procubet umbra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 145</bibl></cit>: procubat horrendus Getico Gradivus in Haemo, Claud. Consol. Prob. et Olyb. 119.</sense></entryFree>
procudo: <entryFree id="n38504" type="main" key="pro_cu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-cūdo</orth>, <itype>di, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fashion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">make by hammering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to forge</hi> a thing. </sense><sense id="n38504.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">in acuta et tenuia posse Mucronum duci fastigia procudendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">enses, Hor C. 4, 15, 19: vomeris obtusi dentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 261</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38504.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prolem propagando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:856" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 856</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38504.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cultirate</hi> (rare but class.): legendo et scribendo vitam procudito, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 156, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non solum acuenda nobis, neque procudenda lingua est, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:30:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 30, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38504.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to forge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi> (ante-class.): haec mihi incus est; procudam<cb n="PROC" />  ego hinc hodie multos dolos, <hi rend="ital">to forge artifices</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1081" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1081</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
procul: <entryFree id="n38505" type="main" key="pro^cul"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏcul</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>procello, to drive away</etym>, <sense id="n38505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the distance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at a distance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a great way off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">far</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afar off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from afar.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38505.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of place (class.; cf.: longe, eminus); constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">adv. of place;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <case>abl.</case> (not in Cic., Cæs., or Sall.); with <case>abl.</case> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">cuja vox sonat procul?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequi procul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non jam procul, sed hic praesentes sua templa dii defendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 13</bibl></cit>. 29: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi turrim constitui procul viderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubet, ut procul tela coniciant, neu propius accedant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procul attendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:36:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 36, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procul e fluctu Trinacria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:554" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 554</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est procul in pelago saxum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procul et e longinquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 3, 2, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus arbitris procul amotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procul o, procul este, profani,</quote> <trans><tr>keep aloof!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui procul astanti, Pettalus irridens dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 114</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">adstans non procul,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 183, 14</bibl></cit>.—With other particles of place, as <hi rend="ital">hinc</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inde</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alicunde</hi>, <hi rend="ital">longe</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">procul hinc stans,</quote> <trans><tr>at a distance from this place</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 1, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">istic procul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istinc procul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procul inde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:14:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 14, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procul alicunde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:20:section=48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 20, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procul longe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">a</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">far from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">far away from</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">procul a terrā abripi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:36:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 36, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse procul a conspectu,</quote> <trans><tr>far out of sight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:32:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 32, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a portā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Ariciā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 26, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hoste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 37, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 18, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a patriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:29:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 29, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Pado,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 17, 21, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a litore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">2: ab ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a fratre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—With simple <case>abl.</case>, <hi rend="ital">far from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">far away from</hi>: patriā procul, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 6, 1</bibl> (Trag. v. 295 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:5:73" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 5, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripā Tiberis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nomento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:16:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 16, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud procul castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Teutoburgiensi Saltu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non procul Euripidis poëtae sepulcro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 19, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbe Romā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 94, 96, § 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38505.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">far</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remote;</hi> constr, with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, the <case>abl.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conscia mihi sum a me culpam hanc esse procul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procul ab omni metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:14:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri, qui sunt procul ab aetatis hujus memoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestia procul sunt a nostrā cognitione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res procul ab ostentatione positae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">4: quis tam procul a litteris, quin sic incipiat,</quote> <trans><tr>so unacquainted with letters</tr>, <tr>so unlettered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:23" default="NO">8, 3, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab odio, ab irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a sapiente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:6:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab omni negotio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 11:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brev. Vit. 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a praesenti modestiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 6</bibl></cit>.— With simple <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber invidiā, procul contentionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam (plebem) procul urbe haberi,</quote> <trans><tr>out of public affairs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:58:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 58, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procul negotiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:1" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 6, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatibus habere aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep one aloof from enjoyments</tr>, <tr>deprive him of them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tali more,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procul dubio,</quote> <trans><tr>without doubt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:27" default="NO">9, 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 61, 87, § 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:40:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 40, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: dubio procul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:812" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 812</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">procul vero est,</quote> <trans><tr>far from the truth</tr>, <tr>untrue</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1 praef.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">assentatio vitiorum adjutrix procul amoveatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 24, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines superbissimi procul errant,</quote> <trans><tr>err widely</tr>, <tr>greatly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperies immunda domus procul absit, i.e. pauperies domestica procul absit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">durabisne procul dominoque legere superstes, Thebai?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:810" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 810</bibl></cit>: non procul est quin, <hi rend="ital">it does not want much of</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">almost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nearly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:335" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 335</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud procul est quin Romam agnosceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38505.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. (post-Aug. and very rare), in estimation of value, <hi rend="ital">far removed from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">much inferior to</hi>: aes suo colore pretiosum, procul a Corinthio (est), <hi rend="ital">is far beneath</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inferior to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">much poorer than</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 2, 3, § 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
procula: <entryFree id="n38506" type="main" key="Pro^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n38506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman woman</hi>, Juv 2, 68; 3, 203. <cb n="PROC" /></sense></entryFree>
proculcatio: <entryFree id="n38507" type="main" key="pro_culca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōculcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>proculco</etym>, <sense id="n38507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a treading down</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n38507.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">obturbata proculcatione aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 18, 26, § 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38507.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruina et proculcatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 11:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 11, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proculcator: <entryFree id="n38508" type="main" key="pro_culca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōculcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who treads down</hi> obstacles; hence, in <number>plur.</number>: proculcatores, <hi rend="ital">advanced troops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scouts</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 10, 10</bibl> (al. procursatores).</sense></entryFree>
proculcatus: <entryFree id="n38509" type="main" key="pro_culca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōculcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from proculco.</entryFree>
proculco: <entryFree id="n38510" type="main" key="pro_culco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-culco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>calco</etym>, <sense id="n38510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tread down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trample upon</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n38510.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbatus eques sua ipse subsidia territis equis proculcavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:36:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 36, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crescenti segetes proculcat in herbā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 290</bibl></cit>; cf. Sev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 6:26:26 sq" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 6, 26, 26 sq.</bibl>—Of a Centaur: <cit><quote lang="la">pedibusque virum proculcat equinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 374</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:19:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 19, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:15:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:32:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 32, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nepotem,</quote> <trans><tr>trample to death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:4:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">una ala ipso impetu proculcata erat,</quote> <trans><tr>crushed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:11:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 11, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: qui tot proculcavimus nives, <hi rend="ital">have trodden</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">traversed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:3:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 3, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38510.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to trample upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tread under foot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui fata proculcavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 193" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proculcato senatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proculcata desertaque respublica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contumeliosā voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:5:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōculcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">trodden down;</hi> trop., = tritus, <hi rend="ital">trodden under foot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">verba proculcata vulgo et protrita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:4:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proculeiani: <entryFree id="n38511" type="main" key="Pro^cu^leia_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏcŭleiāni</orth>, v. Proculus <sense id="n38511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
proculeius: <entryFree id="n38512" type="main" key="Pro^cu^le_ius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏcŭlēius</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n38512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman knight intimate with Augustus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 45, 46, § 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:183" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 24, 59, § 183</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:94" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proculiani: <entryFree id="n38513" type="main" key="Pro^cu^li^a_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏcŭlĭāni</orth>, v. Proculus <sense id="n38513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
proculiunt: <entryFree id="n38514" type="gloss" key="proculi^unt"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proculĭunt</orth>, <itype>promittunt</itype>, ait significare Antistius de jure pontificali L. VIIII., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=253" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 253</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
proculus: <entryFree id="n38515" type="main" key="Pro^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n38515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: Proculum inter cognomina eum dicunt, qui natus est patre peregrinante a patriā procul. Proculos sunt qui credant ideo dictos, quia patribus senibus quasi procul progressā aetate nati sunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=225" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 225</bibl> Müll.—Esp., </sense><sense id="n38515.1" n="1" level="3"> Proculus, <hi rend="ital">a Roman senator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to whom Romulus is said to have imparted his desire to be worshipped as Quirinus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 10, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 3</bibl>; Liv 1, 16.—</sense><sense id="n38515.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated Roman jurist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose disciples are called</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏcŭ-lĭāni</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏcŭleiāni</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:14:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 14, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=53" default="NO">1, 2, 2, § 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
procumbo: <entryFree id="n38516" type="main" key="pro_cumbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-cumbo</orth>, <itype>cŭbŭi, cŭbĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <sense id="n38516.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to fall forwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sink down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prostrate one's self;</hi> of the wounded, the dying, suppliants, etc. (class.; cf.; <cit><quote lang="la">cado, ruo): procumbunt Gallis omnibus ad pedes Bituriges, ne pulcherrimam urbem succendere cogerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genibus, Ov M. 13, 585: ad genua alicujus, Liv 25, 7: ad pedes alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 415</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">templis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:41" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 41</bibl></cit> (1, 2, 83): <cit><quote lang="la">qui vulneribus confecti procubuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 27</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in genua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:5:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Coroebus Penelei dextrā Procumbit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 424</bibl></cit>.—With <case>dat.</case> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sibi tres legiones procubuisse,</quote> <trans><tr>had yielded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteranae cohortes, quibus nuper Othonis legiones procubuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 17</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to fall upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:60:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 60, 3</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">To lean</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bend forwards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">olli certamine summo Procumbunt,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>they bend to their oars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 197</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38516.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate subjects, <hi rend="ital">to lean forwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bend down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be beaten</hi> or <hi rend="ital">broken down</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tigna prona ac fastigiata, ut secundum naturam fluminis procumberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta imbribus procubuerant,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>were beaten down</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne gravidis procumbat culmus aristis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulmus in aram ipsam procumbebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 32, 57, § 132</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of buildings: (domus) in domini procubuit caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:9:14" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta super habitantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:50:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 50, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 176</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38516.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be upset</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break down;</hi> of a vehicle: nam si procubuit qui saxa Ligustica portat Axis, Juv 3, 257.—</sense><sense id="n38516.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to fall</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sink down</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): procumbere in voluptates, <hi rend="ital">to sink into sen</hi> <pb n="1454" /> <cb n="PROC" /> <hi rend="ital">suality</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 18:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 18, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">procumbentem rem publicam restituere,</quote> <trans><tr>sinking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:16:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res procubuere meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:2" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38516.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons Haemus vasto jugo procumbens in Pontum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">planities sub radicibus montium spatiosa procumbit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:4:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
procupido: <entryFree id="n38517" type="main" key="pro_cu^pi_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-cŭpīdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n38517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a previous desire</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">amoris, i. e. anteceptus amor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Octav. 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
procuratio: <entryFree id="n38518" type="main" key="pro_cu_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcūrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>procuro</etym>. <sense id="n38518.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n38518.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A caring for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taking care of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having the charge of</hi> a thing; <hi rend="ital">a charge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superintendence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">administration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">management</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procuration</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dum me rei publicae non solum cura, sed quaedam etiam procuratio multis officiis implicatum et constrictum tenebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum necesse erat, unus omnia poterat: qui, postea quam magistratus creavit, sua cuique procuratio auctoritasque est restituta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:48:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 48, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procuratio templi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mearum rerum existimationisque meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum humanarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministerii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annonae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male gesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 35</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad amplissimas procurationes promotus,</quote> <trans><tr>charges</tr>, <tr>offices</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 31, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38518.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An effort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seeking for</hi> any thing (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quia benignitas eum per sese ipsa delectet, sine ullā recipiendae gratiae procuratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:5:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 5, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38518.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic., of religious acts, an averting or expiating of an evil omen or crime by offering the proper sacrifices, <hi rend="ital">an expiatory sacrifice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expiation</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum terrae motus factus esset, ut sue plena procuratio fieret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:45:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 45, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procurationes incesti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
procuratiuncula: <entryFree id="n38519" type="main" key="pro_cu_ra_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcūrātĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>procuratio</etym>, <sense id="n38519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small charge</hi> or <hi rend="ital">administration</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 31:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 31, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
procurator: <entryFree id="n38520" type="main" key="pro_cu_ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcūrātor</orth> (the first <sense id="n38520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">o</hi> short, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 587</bibl>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>procuro</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a manager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overseer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superintendent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">administrator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deputy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procurator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keeper.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38520.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">procurator peni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procurator, alieni juris vicarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:20:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 20, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere aliquid per procuratorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 16, 9</bibl></cit> (15): <cit><quote lang="la">regni,</quote> <trans><tr>a viceroy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curatori aquarum procuratorem subicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 105" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aviarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procurator nimium procurat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 587</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse procuratorem in rem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procuratorem facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:24" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 4, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38520.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38520.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A manager of an estate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a steward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bailiff</hi> (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">villicus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procurator rationes accipiebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 1, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 20, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38520.4" n="B" level="2"> In the time of the emperors, <hi rend="ital">one who had charge of the imperial revenues</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an imperial collector</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:36:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 36, 3</bibl>.—Esp., in a province: <cit><quote lang="la">Judeae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aegypti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">or in a city: urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38520.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An agent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attorney to conduct an action at law</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:6:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:82" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:84" default="NO">84</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
procuratorius: <entryFree id="n38521" type="main" key="pro_cu_ra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcūrātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>procurator</etym>, <sense id="n38521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to an agent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">manager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procuratory</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:31" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 3, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34" default="NO">34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exceptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:62" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 3, 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
procuratrix: <entryFree id="n38522" type="greek" key="pro_cu_ra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcūrātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a governess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protectress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed cum sapientiam totius hominis custodem et procuratricem esse vellent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:7:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 7, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
procuro: <entryFree id="n38523" type="main" key="pro_cu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-cūro</orth> (the first <sense id="n38523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">o</hi> scanned short, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:13" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 587</bibl>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">to take care of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attend to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look after</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n38523.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.; syn.: curam gero). </sense><sense id="n38523.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc tu te interim, quasi pro puerperā, hic procuras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc puero utere et procura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic sunt trecenti nummi ... hinc me procura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 7, 11</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38523.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, with <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to look after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">care for</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">bene procuras mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victui potuique,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 115</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38523.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to take care of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to manage</hi> one's affairs (class.). </sense><sense id="n38523.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">procurat negotia Dionysii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 24, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <cb n="PROC" /> of religious acts, <hi rend="ital">to avert</hi> or <hi rend="ital">expiate</hi> (evil omens) <hi rend="ital">by sacrifice</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">expio, lustro): monstra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procurare atque expiare signa, quae a diis hominibus portenduntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 63, 130</bibl></cit>;
