<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:37" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificio ostentorum ac fulgurum denuntiationes procurantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38523.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hold a charge</hi> or <hi rend="ital">administration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be procurator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum procuraret in Hispaniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procurante Pontio Pilato Judaeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:2:86" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 2, 86</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat. of person</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">procurare patri,</quote> <trans><tr>to act as agent for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:34:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 34, § 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:1:44" default="NO">27, 1, 44</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">dat. of thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">operibus publicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:8:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—Of religious acts, <hi rend="ital">to make expiation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">atonement</hi>: VT CONSVL HOSTIIS MAIORIBVS IOVI ET MARTI PROCVRARET, S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:6:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 6, 2</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse procuravi, ne possent saeva nocere Somnia, ter sancta deveneranda mola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:13" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul procuratum est, quod tripedem mulum Reate natum nuntiatum erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
procurro: <entryFree id="n38524" type="main" key="pro_curro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-curro</orth>, <itype>cŭcurri and curri, cursum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n38524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to run forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rush forwards.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38524.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.), freq. of armies: <cit><quote lang="la">si Romani ferocius procucurrissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infestis pilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in proximum tumulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6</bibl></cit> 39: <cit><quote lang="la">ad repellendum, et prosequendum hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longius,</quote> <trans><tr>to rush farther on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 690</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversos telum contorsit in hostes Procurrens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 267</bibl></cit>.—Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">qui et procurrentem (bovem) retrahat et cunctantem producat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:26" default="NO">7, 3, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38524.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38524.3" n="1" level="3"> Of locality, <hi rend="ital">to run</hi> or <hi rend="ital">jut out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">project</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">infelix saxis in procurrentibus haesit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra procurrit in aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:419" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 419</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons procurrit in occidentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:27:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 27, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procurrens per medium Euxinum promontorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clupea procurrit a Punico litore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2:19" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:4:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 20, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38524.4" n="2" level="3"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">to extend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix in longitudinem procurrens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 13, 34, § 130</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38524.5" n="3" level="3"> Of money, <hi rend="ital">to increase</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ipso procurrentis pecuniae impetu raptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 101:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 101, 4</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n38524.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to go on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut productus studio, ultra facile procurras,</quote> <trans><tr>that you may advance beyond it</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 47, 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
procursatio: <entryFree id="n38525" type="main" key="pro_cursa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcursātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>procurso</etym>, in milit. lang., <sense id="n38525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a charge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">onset</hi> (only in Livy): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi a velitibus per procursationem commissa pugna esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Numidarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
procursator: <entryFree id="n38526" type="main" key="pro_cursa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-cursātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forerunner;</hi> in military lang., procursatores, <hi rend="ital">skirmishers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sharp-shooters</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not ante-Aug.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:64:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 64, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
procursio: <entryFree id="n38527" type="main" key="pro_cursi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcursĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>procurro</etym>, <sense id="n38527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a running forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stepping forth.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n38527.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of an orator: <cit><quote lang="la">procursio opportuna, brevis, moderata, rara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:126" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 126</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n38527.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a digression</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessaria post narrationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
procurso: <entryFree id="n38528" type="main" key="pro_curso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcurso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n38528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to run forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sally out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make attacks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">onsets.</hi> —Of skirmishers: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ab stationibus procursaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 5, 5, § 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 10, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38528.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to advance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pulcra facinora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 6, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
procursorius: <entryFree id="n38529" type="main" key="pro_curso_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcursōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that runs forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">before</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">index,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 3, 6</bibl></cit> (al. praecursorius).</sense></entryFree>
procursus: <entryFree id="n38530" type="main" key="pro_cursus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōcursus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n38530.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a running forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forwards;</hi> esp., in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a sallying forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">onset</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">procursu militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciles sternit procursibus herbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:787" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 787</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:455" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 455</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38530.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a jutting out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">projection</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">angulosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 10, 11, § 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38530.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">initia procursusque virtutis patefacere,</quote> <trans><tr>the origin and first manifestations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae, qui acerrimus esse solet,</quote> <trans><tr>the outbreak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>, ext. 6.</sense></entryFree>
procurvo: <entryFree id="n38531" type="main" key="pro_curvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-curvo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">curve forwards</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:852" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 852</bibl></cit>: pomiferique simul procurvant bracchia rami, Auct. Carm. de Genesi, 14.</sense></entryFree>
procurvus: <entryFree id="n38532" type="main" key="pro_curvus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-curvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n38532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">curred forwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crooked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winding</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">falx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 421</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:765" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 765</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
procus: <entryFree id="n38533" type="main" key="pro^cus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. procer <sense id="n38533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38534" type="main" key="pro^cus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<sense id="n38534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> procūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:46:156" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 46, 156</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n38534.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A wooer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suitor</hi>: proci <cb n="PROD" /> dicuntur, qui poscunt aliquam in matrimonium, Graece <foreign lang="greek">mnhsth=res</foreign>. Est enim procare poscere, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=249" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 249</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">me natam nulli veterum sociare procorum Fas erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Penelope difficilis procis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apotheca procis intacta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:794" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 794</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 670</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proci loripedes, said of slow people,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n38534.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of canvassers, <hi rend="ital">a suitor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impudentes proci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:96:330" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 96, 330</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
procyon: <entryFree id="n38535" type="main" key="Pro^cy^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏcyon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*proku/wn</foreign> (Foredog), <sense id="n38535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a constellation that rises before the dog-star</hi> (pure Lat. Antecanis), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=222" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 222</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:44:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 44, 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:52" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 197</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prodactus: <entryFree id="n38536" type="main" key="pro_dactus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from prodigo.</entryFree>
prodeambulo: <entryFree id="n38537" type="hapax" key="pro_de^ambu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-dĕambŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n38537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to walk abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take a walk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prodeo: <entryFree id="n38538" type="main" key="pro_de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdĕo</orth>, <itype>ĭi, ĭtum, īre</itype> (lengthened anteclass. form, prodinunt, for prodeunt, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=229" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 229</bibl> Müll.; <sense id="n38538.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">post-class., prodient, for prodibunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>pro-eo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come forth</hi> (class.; cf.: proficiscor, progredior). </sense><sense id="n38538.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodinunt famuli, Enn. l. l.: prodi atque ostium aperi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foras,</quote> <trans><tr>to come out of doors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 158</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:86:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 86, 353</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 4, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemon' huc prodit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in conspectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex portu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad colloquium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in publicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obviam alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to go to meet one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:33:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 33, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in contionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in scenam,</quote> <trans><tr>to come upon the stage</tr>, <tr>make one's appearance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> praef.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:129" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 35, 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 20</bibl>.—Of soldiers in battle: <cit><quote lang="la">in proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:8" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 231</bibl></cit>.—With simple <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">utero matris prodire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:33" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 253</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38538.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38538.3" n="1" level="3"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">to come forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grow up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea seges serius prodit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:45" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodeuntia semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:154" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 154</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38538.4" n="2" level="3"> Of elevations, <hi rend="ital">to stand out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">project</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et immodico prodibant tubere tali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:808" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 808</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 25, 41, § 80</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38538.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38538.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To come forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">show itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appear</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">novae quae prodeunt comoediae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter certo prodit in tragoedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. prol. 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae si prodierit, atque cum prodierit— scio enim proditurum esse—audiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:35:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 35, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si haec consuetudo prodire coeperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:21:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 21, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tot prodierint colores,</quote> <trans><tr>have come up</tr>, <tr>become the fashion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultus et ornatus variis prodisse capillis Obfuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:309" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 309</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu cum, projectis insignibus, prodis ex judice Dama Turpis, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>become manifest</tr>, <tr>turn out to be</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenum prodit Publica cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 8, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38538.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To go forwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">est quadam prodire tenus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodire sumptu extra modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:140" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 39, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodeuntibus annis,</quote> <trans><tr>with advancing years</tr>, <tr>in the course of time</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 25</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ad extremum prodeatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:20:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 20, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prodesse: <entryFree id="n38539" type="main" key="pro_desse"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdesse</orth>, v. prosum.</entryFree>
prodicius: <entryFree id="n38540" type="main" key="pro_di_ci^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>prodo</etym>, <sense id="n38540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">treacherous</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n38541" type="main" key="Pro^di^ci^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏdĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. Prodicus, II.</entryFree>
prodico: <entryFree id="n38542" type="main" key="pro_di_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-dīco</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n38542.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To say beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fix</hi> or <hi rend="ital">appoint beforehand</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">prodictā die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:17:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 17, 45</bibl></cit> (dub.).—</sense><sense id="n38542.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To put off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defer</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">diem prodicere,</quote> <trans><tr>to adjourn the time of trial</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:61:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 61, 7</bibl></cit>; v. Weissenb. ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 20, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:51:5" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 51, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi praetor reo atque accusatoribus diem prodixisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 79</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 7</bibl>, the true read. is praedici; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:42:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 42, 93</bibl>, praedicunt).</sense></entryFree>
prodictator: <entryFree id="n38543" type="main" key="pro_dicta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-dictātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n38543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vice-dictator</hi> (only in Livy): <cit><quote lang="la">prodictatorem populus creavit Q. Fabium Maximum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 8, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">instead of which: pro dictatore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
prodictio: <entryFree id="n38544" type="main" key="pro_dicti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prodico, II.</etym>, <sense id="n38544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deferring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjournment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=253" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 253</bibl>, b <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
prodictus: <entryFree id="n38545" type="main" key="pro_dictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from prodico.</entryFree>
prodicus: <entryFree id="n38546" type="main" key="Pro^di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏdĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pro/dikos</foreign>, <sense id="n38546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Grecian sophist of Ceos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemporary with Socrates</hi>, <pb n="1455" /> <cb n="PROD" /> <hi rend="ital">author of the story of The Choice of Hercules</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:8:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 8, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:32:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 32, 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 12</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n38546.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏdĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Prodicus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Prodicius Hercules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 32, 118</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prodigalitas: <entryFree id="n38547" type="main" key="pro_di^ga_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdĭgālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prodigus</etym>, <sense id="n38547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wastefulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prodigality</hi> (very rare): summa, Auct. Decl. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prodige: <entryFree id="n38548" type="main" key="pro_di^ge_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdĭgē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. prodigus <sense id="n38548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
prodigentia: <entryFree id="n38549" type="main" key="pro_di^genti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdĭgentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prodigo</etym>, <sense id="n38549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">extravagance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profusion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prodigality</hi> (Tacitean; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuria, profusio): prodigentia opum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 14</bibl></cit>; so (opp. avaritia) <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 1</bibl>; 15, 37.</sense></entryFree>
prodigialis: <entryFree id="n38550" type="main" key="pro_di^gi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdĭgĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>prodigium</etym>. <sense id="n38550.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unnatural</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wonderful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portentous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prodigious</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 2, 434</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 467</bibl></cit>.—Adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigiale canens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:403" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cometes prodigiale rubens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 232</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38550.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That averts bad omens</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">prodigialis Juppiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 107</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdĭgĭā-lĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unnaturally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a strange manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prodigiously</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">variare rem unam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prodigiator: <entryFree id="n38551" type="gloss" key="pro_di^gi^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdĭgĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an interpreter of prodigies</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigiatores haruspices, prodigiorum interpretes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=229" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 229</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
prodigiolum: <entryFree id="n38552" type="gloss" key="pro_di^gi^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdĭgĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little prodigy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 96</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prodigiose: <entryFree id="n38553" type="main" key="pro_di^gi^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdĭgĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. prodigiosus <sense id="n38553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
prodigiosus: <entryFree id="n38554" type="main" key="pro_di^gi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdĭgĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>prodigium</etym>, <sense id="n38554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unnatural</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wonderful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">marvellous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prodigious</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">atria Circes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:968" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 968</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura Veneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:727" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 727</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">astra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:523" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 523</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostentatio (virium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 20, 19, § 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:62" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigiosum dictu!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 56</bibl></cit>: ora prodigiosa Tartarei canis, mart. 5, 36, 2.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: quo nihil prodigiosius passa est respublica, Trebell. XXX. Tyr. 31; Salv. Gub. Dei, 7, p. 281. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdĭgĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in an unnatural</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strange</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">wonderful manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lien cum jecinore locum aliquando permutat, sed prodigiose,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 80, § 204</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:95" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 11, 29, § 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prodigitas: <entryFree id="n38555" type="hapax" key="pro_di^gi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdĭgĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prodigus</etym>, <sense id="n38555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">extravagance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prodigality</hi>, Lucil ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 159, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prodigium: <entryFree id="n38556" type="main" key="pro_di^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdĭgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype> (<sense id="n38556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> prodigiūm, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:46:155" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 46, 155</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>for prodicium, from prodico</etym>. </sense><sense id="n38556.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a prophetic sign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">token</hi>, <hi rend="ital">omen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prodigy</hi>, in a good and (more freq.) in a bad sense (syn.: portentum, ostentum, monstrum): mittere, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:26:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 26, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa prodigia vim ejus numenque declarant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:49:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 49, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(lunam deficientem) nullum esse prodigium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:639" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 639</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 77, § 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Clodius fatale portentum prodigiumque rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Catilina) monstrum atque prodigium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mihi jam furtum, sed monstrum ac prodigium videbatur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a monstrous and unnatural crime</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:73:section=171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 73, § 171</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:84" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">piare prodigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipere aliquid in prodigium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigii loco habere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Harpyia Prodigium canit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 366</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinitus factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigiorum perita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigio par est cum nobilitate senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:97" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter multa prodigia libros Sibyllinos adiisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>.—Of miracles: <cit><quote lang="la">signa et prodigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:134:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 134, 9</bibl></cit> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n38556.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a monster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prodigy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ego sum prodigium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:917" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 917</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigium triplex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 9, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu prodigia ventris!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 19, § 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prodigo: <entryFree id="n38557" type="main" key="pro_di^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdĭgo</orth>, <itype>ēgi, actum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pro-ago</etym>, <sense id="n38557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drive</hi> to a place. </sense><sense id="n38557.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sues in lutosos limites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pabulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulli prodigendi in solem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi> —</sense><sense id="n38557.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to get rid of.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38557.3" n="A" level="2"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">to use up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consume</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">esculentum potulentumve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:18:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 18, 18</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38557.4" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">to squander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lavish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissipate</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">effundo, profundo, consumo): festo die si quid prodegeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 60</bibl></cit>: aliena bona, Sall. Or. Lepidi<cb n="PROD" />  contra Sull.: <cit><quote lang="la">opes, Suet. ner. 30: sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi prodigere vitam pro victoriā contendentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 12, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulos artus suos fortunae prodigendos dare quaestu atque compendio gloriarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:27:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 27, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prodiguae: <entryFree id="n38558" type="gloss" key="pro_di^gu^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdĭgŭae</orth>, <itype>hostiae vocantur, ut ait Veranius</itype>, quae consumuntur: <sense id="n38558.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">unde homines quoque luxuriosi prodigi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=250" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 250</bibl></cit> Müll. [prodigo].</sense></entryFree>
prodigus: <entryFree id="n38559" type="main" key="pro_di^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdĭgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>prodigo</etym>, <sense id="n38559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wasteful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lavish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prodigal.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38559.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: largus, munificus): omnino duo sunt genera largorum, quorum alteri prodigi, alteri liberales. Prodigi, qui epulis et viscerationibus et gladiatorum muneribus, ludorum venationumque apparatu, pecunias profundunt in eas res, quarum memoriam aut levem aut nullam omnino sint relicturi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 16, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:362" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 362</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peculii sui prodigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 164</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 500</bibl>.— As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdĭgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a wasteful person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a spendthrift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prodigal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">largitor et prodigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lege XII. tabularum prodigo interdicitur bonorum suorum administratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:10:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 10, 1</bibl></cit> prooem.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Reg. 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:53" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigus ad bonos mores reversus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 4</bibl></cit>, a, 12.—</sense><sense id="n38559.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38559.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Causing great expense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">costly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expensive</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">margaritae, prodiga res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 6, § 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38559.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Rich</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abounding in</hi> any thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>); with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus prodigus herbae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 42</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <trans><tr>rich</tr>, <tr>fertile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38559.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Abundant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">odor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 3, 5, § 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvus,</quote> <trans><tr>great</tr>, <tr>stout</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 104</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38559.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">lavish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prodigal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profuse;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigus suae alienaeque et fortunae et pudicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:48:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 48, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcanique Fides prodiga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicii sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:5:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animaeque magnae Prodigum Paulum,</quote> <trans><tr>careless of life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">prodiga gens animae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:225" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 225</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidines in cibos atque in Venerem prodigae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:2:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed finem impensae non servat prodiga Roma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:138" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodiga corruptoris Improbitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:304" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 304</bibl></cit>: prodigis oculis intueri, <hi rend="ital">with greedy eyes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with voluptuous glances</hi>, Auct. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 292" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 292</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdĭgē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">lavishly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extravagantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prodigally</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">prodige vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:30" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prodinunt: <entryFree id="n38560" type="main" key="pro_dinunt"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdinunt</orth>, v. prodeo <sense id="n38560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
proditio: <entryFree id="n38561" type="main" key="pro_di^ti^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prodo</etym>. <sense id="n38561.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A discovering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">betraying; a discovery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">betrayal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treachery</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">multorum in nos perfidiam, insidias, proditionem notabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiarum proditiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 45, 46, § 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id nefas proditione discussum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:18:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 18, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timor est proditio cogitationis auxiliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 17, 11</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n38561.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A putting off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deferring; the right of deferring</hi> (ante-class.), Cato ap. Fest. s. v. prodidisse, p. 242 Müll.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38562" type="main" key="pro_di^ti^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prodeo</etym>, <sense id="n38562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going</hi> or <hi rend="ital">coming forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an appearance</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38562.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a sally</hi> by a besieged garrison: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestiva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proditor: <entryFree id="n38563" type="main" key="pro_di^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>prodo</etym>, <sense id="n38563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a betrayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">traitor</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum senatus duces nullos ac pro ducibus proditores haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 15, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proditor patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:19:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 19, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 59</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">risus proditor latentis puellae,</quote> <trans><tr>betraying</tr>, <tr>treacherous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proditrix: <entryFree id="n38564" type="main" key="pro_ditrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōditrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>proditor</etym>, <sense id="n38564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female betrayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a traitress</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">patris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proditrices numinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 8, 30</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: Fama proditrix, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 1, 11.</sense></entryFree>
proditus: <entryFree id="n38565" type="main" key="pro_di^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from prodo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38566" type="main" key="pro_di^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n38566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">treachery</hi> (late Lat.), Jul. ap. Aug. c. Sec. Resp. Jul. 3, 168.</sense></entryFree>
prodius: <entryFree id="n38567" type="hapax" key="pro_di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdĭus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>prodeo</etym>, <sense id="n38567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">farther onwards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodius dictum interius, longius, a prodeundo, quasi porro eundo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 47, 13 sq.</bibl></cit>; Varr. ap. Non. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
prodo: <entryFree id="n38568" type="main" key="pro_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-do</orth>, <itype>dĭdi, dĭtum, 3</itype> (archaic produit for prodiderit, = porro dederit, porticum sartam tectamque habeto, prodito, Lex Censor. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=229:17" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 229, 17</bibl> Müll.; <sense id="n38568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pres. part. abl. sing.</hi> prodente, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:13:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 13, 31</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <cb n="PROD" /> </sense><sense id="n38568.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To give</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">bring forth</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. edo, profero, promo): prodit fumoso con dita vina cado,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:518" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 518</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspiria pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 656</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hydraulam et choraulam,</quote> <trans><tr>to show</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum tur pe,</quote> <trans><tr>to give a bad example</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:119:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 119, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perniciosum exemplum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodendi exempli causā,</quote> <trans><tr>of setting an example</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 11, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38568.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38568.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): parvā prodite patriā, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae tam festa dies ut cesset prodere furem, Perfidiam, fraudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:23" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38568.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To put forth in writing</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to publish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">report</hi>, <hi rend="ital">record</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum decretum proditur, lex veri rectique proditur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Procilius non idem prodidit, quod Piso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=148" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae scriptores Graeciae prodiderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:13:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 13, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec monumenta nobis litterae prodiderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:39:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 39, 94</bibl></cit>: Thucydides ossa ejus clam ab amicis esse sepulta, memoriae prodidit, <hi rend="ital">has handed down to memory</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">has recorded</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 10, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus bella gesta multi memoriae prodiderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hann. 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut produnt,</quote> <trans><tr>as they say</tr>.</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 16, § 33</bibl></cit>: prodere aliquid memoriā, <hi rend="ital">to put forth from memory</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to record</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos natos in insulā ipsā, memoriā proditum dicunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quod proditum memoriā est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 31, 54</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">to publish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclaim</hi> any one as appointed to an office, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to appoint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">create</hi> a public officer of any kind (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">creo, designo): cum populo agendi jus esto ei, quem produnt patres consulum creandorum ergo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">flaminem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:17:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 17, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interregem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 14, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 18</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">to make known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">betray</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homine prodente conscios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:13:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen vultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 447</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam prodiderim quidquid scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:97" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 115</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38568.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To betray perfidiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrender treacherously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Brutum prodideritis, et deserueritis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is me deseruit ac prodidit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 33, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 14, 32</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:33:section=84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 33, § 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodebas caput et salutem meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:24:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 24, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem praedonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:41:section=106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 41, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hosti rempublicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:9:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 9, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38568.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abandon</hi>: rem summam, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=229" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 229</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 411 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">suam vitam, et Pecuniam omnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38568.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permit to go farther.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38568.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To put off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defer</hi> (anteclass.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=242" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 242</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n38568.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To prolong</hi>, = produco, de mendico male meretur qui ei dat quod edit, nam illi prodit vitam ad miseriam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:58 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 58 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n38568.10" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hand down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transmit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bequeath</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui sacra suis posteris prodiderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:30:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 30, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus imaginis ad memoriam posteritatemque prodendae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:14:section=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 14, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum a Tantalo proditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:21:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 21, 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38568.11" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To propagate</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">qui genus alto a sanguine Teucri Proderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 230</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prodoceo: <entryFree id="n38569" type="main" key="pro_do^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-dŏcĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to teach before</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to show by teaching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to inculcate</hi> (= docere altā voce et palam): <cit><quote lang="la">haec Janus summus ab imo Prodocet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 55</bibl></cit> (perh. imitation of the Greek <foreign lang="greek">prodida/skein</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
prodormio: <entryFree id="n38570" type="main" key="pro_dormi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-dormĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n38570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sleep before</hi> (post - Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sive prodormias, sive pervigiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 1, 4</bibl></cit> Mai; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ib. 4:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6</bibl>; 5, 22.</sense></entryFree>
prodromus: <entryFree id="n38571" type="greek" key="prodro^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prodrŏmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pro/dromos</foreign>. <sense id="n38571.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A certain north-northeast wind that blows eight days before the rising of the dog-star</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodromi nulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 47, § 123</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38571.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of early fig</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 26, 49, § 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
producibilis: <entryFree id="n38572" type="main" key="pro_du_ci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdūcĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n38572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">which lengthens out</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">incus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Interpr. Orig. in Jer. Hom. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
produco: <entryFree id="n38573" type="main" key="pro_du_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-dūco</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype> (produxe, for produxisse, Ter Ad. 4, 2, 22), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lead</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lead forward</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38573.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fidicinam intus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem foras ante aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem e latebris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castris omnem exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias pro castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48</bibl></cit>.—Esp. </sense><sense id="n38573.2" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To bring before</hi> the people, senate, or a court: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in conspectum populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:47:section=122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 47, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quempiam in contionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: cum tribunis <pb n="1456" /> <cb n="PROD" /> plebis Curionem et Octavium consules produxisset, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:60:217" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 60, 217</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 7, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">harum rerum omnium auctores testesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:50:section=131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 50, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">productus pro rostris,</quote> <trans><tr>to give evidence</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Jul. 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">producti in circo Flaminio in contionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in judicium,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring before a court</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:43:section=113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 43, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in Sestium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad necem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:60:section=157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 60, § 157</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38573.3" n="b" level="4"> Of an actor, <hi rend="ital">to represent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ab hoc (Roscio) pravum et perversum produci posse arbitrabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 10, 30</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n38573.4" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To expose for sale</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancillam produxit, vendidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38573.5" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To draw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">place</hi> one thing <hi rend="ital">before</hi> another (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">producere malo aliquam moram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scamnum lecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubila menti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:13" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38573.6" n="e" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To draw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stretch out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lengthen out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">pelles dentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:74:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 74, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum incude,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:165" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supercilium madidā fuligine tactum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lineas ex argento nigras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 31, § 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38573.7" n="f" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To conduct to</hi> a place: <cit><quote lang="la">non tu eum rus hinc modo Produxe aiebas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 22</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38573.8" n="g" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To conduct to the grave</hi>, sc. a corpse or a funeral procession (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nec te, tua funera, mater Produxi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:486" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 486</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longum funus ad tumulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 298</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38573.9" n="h" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To lead</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring along</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui et procurrentem retrahat, et cunctantem producat,</quote> <trans><tr>to drag forward</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38573.10" n="i" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To bring to light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">occulta ad patres produxit crimina servus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:266" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 266</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n38573.11" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38573.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring into the world</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beget</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego is sum qui te produxi pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 105</bibl></cit>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 373, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnanimos nos natura produxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 104:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 104, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam te Thersitae similem producat Achilles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:271" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 271</bibl></cit>.— Of other subjects, <hi rend="ital">to produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cibis utendum est carnem producentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum folia producere incipiunt fici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 10, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38573.13" n="2" level="3"> = adduco in indicium, <hi rend="ital">to bring forth to trial</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:12:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 12, § 32</bibl> (Zumpt); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:174" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 174</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38573.14" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make to grow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promote</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): subolem. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:17" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38573.15" n="4" level="3"> In pronunciation, <hi rend="ital">to lengthen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prolong</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">inclitus dicimus brevi primā litterā, insanus productā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:159" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 48, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllabam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:12:13" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 12, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38573.16" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38573.17" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bring forward</hi> (to distinction), <hi rend="ital">to raise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advance</hi> (class.): producere aliquem ad aliquam dignitatem. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:16:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 16, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem omni genere honoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem tu non pro illius dignitate produxeras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quibus producti sunt, exsistunt eorum ipsorum tyranni,</quote> <trans><tr>advanced to power</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 44, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficia, quae non producunt, nec honestiorem faciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:9:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38573.18" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">induce</hi> one to do any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">producti sumus, ut loqueremur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">productus ad aliquid faciendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 59, § 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38573.19" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To draw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drag out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lengthen out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prolong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protract</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">producere pauperi vitam ad miseriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivium ad multam noctem vario sermone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 14, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem in multam noctem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:10:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem longius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:71:251" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 71, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Varro .. vitam Naevii producit longius,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>represents him as having lived longer</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnum ultra primam lucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:78" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem in hiemem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animas,</quote> <trans><tr>lives</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:94" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38573.20" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To put off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to amuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delude</hi> one with fallacious promises: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem falsā spe producere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem conditionibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 8, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38573.21" n="D" level="2"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to pass</hi>, <hi
