rend="ital">spend</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">cyathos sorbillans diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38573.22" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bring up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">educate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">audientem dicto, mater, produxisti filiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principes liberos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laevo monitu pueros avaros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:228" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 228</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38573.23" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring into use</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova (vocabula) quae genitor produxerit usus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 119</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38573.24" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cultivate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicunque primum te produxit, arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōductus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">lengthened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prolonged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protracted</hi>, etc. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">productiore cornu sinistro,</quote> <trans><tr>drawn out</tr>, <tr>extended</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 40</bibl></cit> Halm: <cit><quote lang="la">productissimum flagellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10</bibl></cit>: commoditates corporis <cb n="PROE" /> tam productae temporibus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:12:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 12, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolores longinquitate producti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:40:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 40, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitus (orationis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2</bibl></cit>. 53, 213: <cit><quote lang="la">productiora alia, et quasi immoderatius excurrentia,</quote> <trans><tr>too long</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:53:178" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 53, 178</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">producta syllaba (opp. short),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 48, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <trans><tr>formed by prolongation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:26:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 26, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neve minor, neu sit quinto productior actu Fabula,</quote> <trans><tr>longer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 189</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38573.25" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōducta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">preferable things</hi> (a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ta( prohgme/na</foreign>): in vitā non ea, quae primario loco sunt, sed ea, quae secundum locum obtinent, <foreign lang="greek">prohgme/na</foreign>, id est producta nominantur; quae vel ita appellemus (id erit verbum e verbo), vel promota, et remota, vel, ut dudum diximus, praeposita, vel praecipua; <cit><quote lang="la">et illa rejecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:16:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 16, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 74:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 74, 17</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōductē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a lengthened manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">long</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">producte dicere litteram, opp. breviter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:159" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 48, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">producte dicere syllabam, opp. correpte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:17:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 17, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllaba productius pronunciata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:17:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 17, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
productilis: <entryFree id="n38574" type="gloss" key="pro_ducti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōductĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>produco</etym>. <sense id="n38574.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That may be drawn out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ductile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">productile</hi>: productile, <foreign lang="greek">e)lato/n</foreign>, Gloss.—</sense><sense id="n38574.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of beaten work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of highly wrought metal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cherubim aurei et productiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:25:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 25, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tubae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ecclus. 50, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
productio: <entryFree id="n38575" type="main" key="pro_ducti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōductĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n38575.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A lengthening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prolonging</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">productio temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:14:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:8:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 8, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38575.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A lengthening</hi> in pronunciation: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aut contractione brevius fieret, aut productione longius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:50:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 50, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces aut productione aut correptione mutatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 69</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 9, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
productivus: <entryFree id="n38576" type="main" key="pro_ducti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōductīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fit for prolongation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 1, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
producto: <entryFree id="n38577" type="hapax" key="pro_ducto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōducto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to draw</hi> one thing <hi rend="ital">before</hi> another, <hi rend="ital">to interpose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut huic malo aliquam productem moram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 9</bibl></cit> Fleck.</sense></entryFree>
productor: <entryFree id="n38578" type="gloss" key="pro_ductor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōductor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leader away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an enticer</hi> (perh. a pander): productor, <foreign lang="greek">proagwgo/s</foreign>, Vet. Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
productus: <entryFree id="n38579" type="main" key="pro_ductus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōductus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from produco.</entryFree>
produx: <entryFree id="n38580" type="main" key="pro_dux"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōdux</orth>, <itype>dŭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>produco</etym>, <sense id="n38580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a twig</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shoot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">layer;</hi> trop. (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carn. Chr. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proebia: <entryFree id="n38581" type="main" key="proebi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proebĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. praebia.</entryFree>
proegmenon: <entryFree id="n38582" type="greek" key="pro^e_gme^non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏēgmĕnon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">prohgme/non</foreign> (in pure Lat. productum; v. producta, in produco <sense id="n38582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">a preferable thing</hi>, acc. to the Stoic philosophy, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:4:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 4, 15</bibl> (as Greek, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 15, 51</bibl> al.).</sense></entryFree>
proelialis: <entryFree id="n38583" type="main" key="proeli^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proelĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. procliaris.</entryFree>
proeliaris: <entryFree id="n38584" type="main" key="proeli^a_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proelĭāris</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">prael-</orth>) and <orth extent="full" lang="la">proelĭā-lis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>proelium</etym>, <sense id="n38584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a battle</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pugnae proeliares,</quote> <trans><tr>pitched battles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 208, 40</bibl></cit>: proeliares dies appellantur, quibus fas est hostem bello lacessere, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=266" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 266</bibl> Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">called also proeliales dies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proeliaris dea,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Minerva</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 254, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proeliatio: <entryFree id="n38585" type="main" key="proeli^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proelĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>proelior</etym>, <sense id="n38585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the battling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fighting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra inter nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 3:8:4" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 3, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proeliator: <entryFree id="n38586" type="main" key="proeli^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proelĭātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">prael-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fighter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warrior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">combatant</hi> (post - Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proeliator insignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 15, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in appos.: proeliator miles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:42:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 42, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proelio: <entryFree id="n38587" type="main" key="proeli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proelĭo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (ante-class.; collat. form of proelior): mortales inter sese pugnant, proeliant, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 472, 31</bibl> (Trag. v. 26 Vahl.); cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 799</bibl> P.—<sense id="n38587.0" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proeliatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 19, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proelior: <entryFree id="n38588" type="main" key="proeli^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proelĭor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">prael-</orth>), <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n38588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [proelium], <hi rend="ital">to join battle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to engage in battle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fight</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38588.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones in ipsis fluminis ripis proeliabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Syracusas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:25:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 25, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita proelians interficitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortissime proeliando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:19" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes inter se et cum alteris quasi cum exteris gentibus proeliantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:9:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 9, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Alex. 44" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Alex. 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 11, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella Domini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:18:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 18, 17</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n38588.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38588.3" n="A" level="2"> In mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex animo proeliabor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 119, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38588.4" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to contend</hi>,<cb n="PROF" />  <hi rend="ital">fight with words</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementer proeliatus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proelium: <entryFree id="n38589" type="main" key="proeli^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proelĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">prael-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; perh. for provilium, pro-dvilium; cf. duellum (bellum)</etym>, <sense id="n38589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a battle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">combat</hi> (class.; syn.: pugna, dimicatio). </sense><sense id="n38589.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">induperatores pugnare ac proelia obire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:967" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 967</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non proeliis, neque acie bellum gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 54:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 54, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitus proeliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to engage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:19:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 19, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">committere cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:35:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 35, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redintegrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">restituere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:28" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 28: <cit><quote lang="la">proelio dimicare cum hoste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proeliis decertare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium sumere,</quote> <trans><tr>to join battle</tr>, <tr>engage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulare,</quote> <trans><tr>single combat</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Per. Iliad. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Punica passi proelia,</quote> <trans><tr>the wars with Carthage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:162" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 162</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38589.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38589.3" n="1" level="3"> Of animals (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">proelia dant cervi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(taurorum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 220</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 20, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 13, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38589.4" n="2" level="3"> Of inanimate subjects (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ventorum proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 318</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38589.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A warrior</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Colchis flagrantes adamantina sub juga tauros Egit et armigera proelia sevit humo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 11</bibl></cit> (4, 10), 10: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidum si Martis operti agricolam infandis condentem proelia sulcis expediam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38589.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38589.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Contest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strife</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">proelia te meā causā sustinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">committere proelia voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 307</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 8, 96</bibl>.—Humorously, of a struggle with food and drink: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo uterque proelio potabimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quid cessamus proelium committere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38589.8" n="B" level="2"> In mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:45" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veneris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 168, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proemineo: <entryFree id="n38590" type="gloss" key="proe_mi^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pro-ēmĭnĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n38590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to project</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">proku/ptw</foreign>, proemineo, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
proerna: <entryFree id="n38591" type="main" key="Pro^erna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prŏërna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pro/erna</foreign>, <sense id="n38591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Thessaly</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Ghynekokastro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proetus: <entryFree id="n38592" type="main" key="Proetus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Proetus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*proi=tos</foreign>, <sense id="n38592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Tiryns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brother of Acrisius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:238 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 238 sq.</bibl> —<orth extent="full" lang="la">Proetĭdes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*proitides</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">his daughters</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who being punished with madness by Juno for their pride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imagined themselves to be cows</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Proetides implerunt falsis mugitibus agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 326</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 21, § 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
profanatio: <entryFree id="n38593" type="main" key="pro^fa_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfānātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. profano</etym>, <sense id="n38593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">profanation</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
profanator: <entryFree id="n38594" type="main" key="pro^fa_na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfānātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a profaner</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">profanator Christi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 246</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
profane: <entryFree id="n38595" type="main" key="pro^fa_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfānē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. profanus <sense id="n38595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
profanitas: <entryFree id="n38596" type="main" key="pro^fa_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfānĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>profanus</etym>, <sense id="n38596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">profaneness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profanity</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">superiorum profanitas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the ancient heathen writers</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
profano: <entryFree id="n38597" type="main" key="pro_fa_no1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōfāno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pro-fanum</etym>, <sense id="n38597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">to a god before the temple</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to dedicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consecrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offer in sacrifice</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">daps profanata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profanato sine contagione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 132</bibl></cit>: decimam Herculi, Massur. Sabin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 6</bibl>: ad aram decimam bovum, Fest. s. v. potitium, p. 237 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Orig. Gent. Rom. 6" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Orig. Gent. Rom. 6</bibl>: polluctum cum profanatum dicitur, id est proinde ut sit fani factum; <cit><quote lang="la">itaque olim fano consumebatur omne quod profanum erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=54" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 54</bibl></cit> Müll. (the passage is corrupt).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38598" type="main" key="pro^fa_no2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfāno</orth>, <itype>āvi, atum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>profanus</etym>. <sense id="n38598.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to render unholy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deprive of sanctity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to unhallow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desecrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profane</hi> (perh. not ante - Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">dies festos, sacra, sacerdotes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">festum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 390</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:8" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sabbata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:23:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 23, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:88:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 88, 32</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38598.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38598.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To violate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pollute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:38" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:84" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Decl. 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38598.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To disclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reveal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">betray</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secreta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 164, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res profanata non valeat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
profanus: <entryFree id="n38599" type="main" key="pro^fa_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pro - fanum; prop. before the temple, i. e. outside of it; hence, opp. to the temple as a sacred object</etym>, <sense id="n38599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unholy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not sacred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profane.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38599.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: profanum quod non est sacrum, Plautus: Sacrum an profanum habeas parvi penditur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=228" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 228</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">profanum est, quod fani religione non tenetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=253" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 253</bibl></cit> ib.: Trebatius profanum id proprie dici ait, quod ex religioso vel sacro <pb n="1457" /> <cb n="PROF" /> in hominum usum proprietatem conversum est, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci consecrati an profani,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 10, 36</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. sacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 27</bibl></cit> cum omnia illā victoriā suā profana fecisset, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Verr 2, 4, 55, § 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res profanae et usu pollutae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:440" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 440</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 40, § 135</bibl></cit>.—Of persons: procul o, procul este, profani, Conclamat vates, <hi rend="ital">ye uninitiated</hi>, Verg A. 6, 258: <cit><quote lang="la">Cereris ritus vulgare profanis, Ov A. A. 2, 601 profanum vulgus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: vulgus, Gell. N A. praef. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>— </sense><sense id="n38599.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38599.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Wicked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impious</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">mens profana, Ov M 2, 833: verba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 5, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: profanus Phorbas, Ov M. 11, 413 sit spes fallendi, miscebis sacra profanis, Hor Ep. 1, 16, 54.— <pos>Subst.</pos> <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">wickedness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impiety</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">civilium bellorum profano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 4, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38599.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unlearned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignorant</hi> (post-class.); with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum profani (opp.: doctrina initiati),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Oct. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui profani sunt a sacramento veritatis,</quote> <trans><tr>strangers to</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a veritate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 16, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 24, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38599.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Ill-boding</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">profanus bubo, Ov M 6, 431 avis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 543</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfānē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">wickedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profanely</hi> (post-class.); <cit><quote lang="la">illudere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 23, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de divinitate disputare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Oct. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
profatum: <entryFree id="n38600" type="main" key="pro^fa_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v profor <sense id="n38600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
profatus: <entryFree id="n38601" type="main" key="pro^fa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (only in <sense id="n38601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>profor</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a speaking out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uttering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pronouncing</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">effreno nimbos aequare profatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:103" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apoc. 7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Apoc. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces dictu profatuque ipso tetrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:11:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 11, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
profecticius: <entryFree id="n38602" type="main" key="pro^fecti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfectīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>proficiscor</etym>, <sense id="n38602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that proceeds from some one</hi> (post-class.); <cit><quote lang="la">profecticia dos est, quae a patre vel parente profecta est, de bonis vel facto ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 3, 5</bibl></cit>, §§ 1, 6, 14; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
profectio: <entryFree id="n38603" type="main" key="pro^fecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n38603.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a going away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">setting out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">departure</hi> (class.): profectione laeti, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:14:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 14, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">profectio et reversio alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: profectionem parare, <hi rend="ital">to prepare for setting out</hi>, Caes B. C. 1, 27. Cethegi profectio in Hispaniam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:25:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 25, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 6</bibl>; Liv 2, 14; 38, 59.—</sense><sense id="n38603.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">the source</hi> whence any thing is obtained: <cit><quote lang="la">profectio ipsius pecuniae requiratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:30:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 30, 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
profecto: <entryFree id="n38604" type="main" key="pro^fecto_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfectō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>pro-facto</etym>, a particle of affirmation, confirmation, and declaration, <sense id="n38604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">actually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">really</hi>, <hi rend="ital">truly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assuredly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by all means</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>, etc. (very freq. and class.): neque di regunt neque profecto deūm summus rex omnibus curat, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1, 59</bibl> (Trag. Rel v 142 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">profecto edepol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profecto, ut loquor, res ita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est ita, judices, non est profecto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 22, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retorquet oculos profecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profecto negare non potes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr 2, 2, 18, § 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc quidem profecto Romae es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 5, 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si modo di sunt, ut profecto sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:31:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 31, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meministi enim profecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 315</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:3:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 3, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 12, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 24, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 7, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 10, 23</bibl>; Liv 1, 15; 44, 2; 54, 1.—Strengthened by other particles; <cit><quote lang="la">profecto hercle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vere enim profecto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Pan. Const. 7</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
profector: <entryFree id="n38605" type="gloss" key="pro^fector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> [proficiscor), <sense id="n38605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a traveller</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">*)/ekdhmos</foreign>, profector, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
profectus: <entryFree id="n38606" type="main" key="pro_fectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōfectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from proficio</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n38607" type="main" key="pro^fectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from proficiscor</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38608" type="main" key="pro_fectus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōfectus</orth> (with the first syllable short, Aus. ldyll. 4, 70), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>proficio</etym>, <sense id="n38608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">progress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">growth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">success</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">sine profectu, Ov M. 9, 50: verbaque profectu dissimulata carent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 9, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:4:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:223" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 223</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:4" default="NO">12, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:26" default="NO">1, 2, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo quantum esset ingenii, quantum etiam profectus, sermo primus ostendit,</quote> <trans><tr>progress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 11:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">experimentum profectus tui capere animi firmitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 20:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec blandlente profectu prodire in scenam concupiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer magni profectus in eā arte obiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 4, 7, § 21</bibl></cit>.—So, <hi rend="ital">the improvement</hi>,<cb n="PROF" />  <hi rend="ital">convalescence</hi> of the sick, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:9:54" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 9, 54</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">in similitudine et temporum et profectuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:16:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
profera: <entryFree id="n38609" type="main" key="Pro_fe^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prōfĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prefero</etym>, <sense id="n38609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that presents</hi>, <hi rend="ital">makes known</hi>, i. e. the goddess of Arithmetic, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 803</bibl> Kopp ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
profero: <entryFree id="n38610" type="main" key="pro_fe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-fĕro</orth>, <itype>tŭli, lātum, ferre</itype> (<sense id="n38610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> parag. proferrier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 207</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">proferis for profers,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Firm. Mat.</author> 22, 3</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n38610.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38610.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To carry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring forth</hi> (class.; cf.: prodo, produco, adduco): <hi rend="ital">Al.</hi> Vin' proferri pateram? <hi rend="ital">Am.</hi> Proferri volo. <hi rend="ital">Al.</hi> Fiat: <cit><quote lang="la">tu, Thessala, intus pateram proferto foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma tormentaque ex oppido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(nummos) ex arcā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 11, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38610.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stretch</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">thrust out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam in tussiendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:25:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 25, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38610.4" n="3" level="3"> Se proferre, <hi rend="ital">to raise one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">show one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appear</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">draco e pulvino se proferens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38610.5" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To offer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proffer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui minas viginti argenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 60</bibl></cit>.—Esp., </sense><sense id="n38610.6" n="5" level="3"> Proferre gradum or pedem, <hi rend="ital">to go on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradum proferam, progredi properabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: gradum pedum proferre, Enn ap <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=249" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 249</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">passus, Lucr 4, 874: longe pedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:160" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 160</bibl></cit>; cf.: pedem, Hor A. P 135. —</sense><sense id="n38610.7" n="6" level="3"> As milit. t. t.: signa proferre, <hi rend="ital">to advance the standards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">march on</hi>, Liv 4, 32, 10; so, <cit><quote lang="la">proferre inde castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:33:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 33, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid ab urbe longius proferrent arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:32:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 32, 6</bibl></cit>.—Also, </sense><sense id="n38610.8" n="7" level="3"> Nautical t t.: <cit><quote lang="la">pedibus profatis in contrarium navigare,</quote> <trans><tr>to sail close to the wind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:47:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">prolato pede transversos captare notos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 321" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 321</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38610.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38610.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause to grow</hi>, of plants (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">caelum laurum patitur, atque etiam nitidissimam profert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 13, 20, § 95</bibl></cit> (al. perfert). —</sense><sense id="n38610.11" n="2" level="3"> Of pronunciation, <hi rend="ital">to utter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pronounce</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">extremas syllabas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38610.12" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enlarge</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">castra, Caes, B. C. 1, 81: et proferre libet fines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:142" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomoerium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:14:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 14, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38610.13" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To put off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjourn</hi>, etc. (class.): rem aliquot dies, Cat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctionis diem laxius proferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in diem posterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:23:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 23, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 20, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38610.14" n="5" level="3"> Of a painter, <hi rend="ital">to bring out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to represent distinctly</hi> (post-Aug.); <cit><quote lang="la">venas protulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 8, 34, § 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38610.15" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38610.16" n="A" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to raise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevate one's self</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui se ipsi protulerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>who have raised themselves from ignorance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 52:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 52, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38610.17" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bring out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce in public</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publish</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ejus (orationis) proferendae arbitrium tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artem,</quote> <trans><tr>to exhibit publicly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner 25</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n38610.18" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reveal</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">artem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palam proferre aliquid, Ter Ad. 3, 2, 41: cum illa indicia communis exitii indagavi, patefeci, protuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:37:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 37, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:23:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 23, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem in medium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secreta animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Montanum, quia protulerit ingenium, extorrem agi,</quote> <trans><tr>displayed his genius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n38610.19" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bring forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mention</hi> (class.); <cit><quote lang="la">libros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:40:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 40, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testes, legatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:18:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 18, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or 2, 71, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominatim multos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am 16, 47</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">paucos belli duces praestantissimos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinolentiam alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:39:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 39, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim, potentiam, factiones, divitias, clientelas, affinitates adversariorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in medium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Verr 2, 4, 52, § 115</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:23:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 23, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriter Progeniem suam usque ab avo atque atavo, Ter Phorm. 2, 3, 48: exempla omnium nota,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div 1, 46, 103</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38610.20" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enlarge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines officiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:31:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 31, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam alicujus,</quote> <trans><tr>to prolong</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vita ejus debuerit inmortalitate proferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; 3, 7, 14.—</sense><sense id="n38610.21" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To impel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si paulo longius pietas Caecilium protulisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:23:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 23, 64</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se ad clarissimorum civium strages caedesque proferret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:48" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38610.22" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To lengthen out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prolong</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">beatam vitam usque ad rogum proferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:22:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 22, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut depositi proferret fata parentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 395</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
professio: <entryFree id="n38611" type="main" key="pro^fessi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfessĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>profiteor</etym>, <sense id="n38611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a public acknowledgment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declaration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expression</hi>, <cb n="PROF" /> <hi rend="ital">profession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promise</hi> (mostly post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n38611.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: professio bonae voluntatis, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Canidius timidius decessit, quam professioni ejus congruebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:87:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 87, 3</bibl></cit>: memores professionis, <hi rend="ital">of our promise</hi> (<hi rend="ital">of brevity</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:89:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 89, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aperta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 3, 2, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suae opinionis,</quote> <trans><tr>expression</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:24" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa stultitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pietatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38611.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a sign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">token</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vitiorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38611.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a public declaration</hi> or <hi rend="ital">specification</hi> of one's person, name, property, business, etc. (class.): IS. APVD. QVEM. EA. PROFESSIO FIET, etc., Tab. Her. in Haubold, Mon. Leg. p. 101 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu vero confice professionem, si potes. Etsi haec pecunia ex eo genere est, ut professione non egeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post professionem de fideicommisso factam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:14:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 5, 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38611.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38611.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A public register</hi> of persons or property thus given in (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in Leontino jugerum subscriptio ac professio non est plus triginta millium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:47:section=113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 47, § 113</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38611.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A business</hi> or <hi rend="ital">profession</hi> which one publicly avows (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">professio bene dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grammaticae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 30, 31, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magicae artis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">professionem honestarum artium malis corruperant moribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:5:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: ista salutaris, <hi rend="ital">the art of healing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">medicine</hi>, Cels. praef.: <cit><quote lang="la">ultimae professionis homines, i. e. vilissimi artificii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 20</bibl></cit>; Dig 2, 13, 9.</sense></entryFree>
professionarius: <entryFree id="n38612" type="gloss" key="pro^fessi^o_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfessĭōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>professio</etym>, perh. <sense id="n38612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a registrar of wares</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one who fixed the duties on imported goods</hi>, Inscr. Marin. Frat. Arv. p. 151.</sense></entryFree>
professor: <entryFree id="n38613" type="main" key="pro^fessor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfessor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>profiteor</etym>, <sense id="n38613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a public teacher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">professor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one who makes instruction in any branch a business</hi> (post-Aug.): sapientiae professores, Cels. praef. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterarum artium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latinae simul Graecaeque eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">astrologiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:12" default="NO">11, 1, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris civilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:13:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus etiam consummatis professoribus difficile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:9:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa scholas professorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38613.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a professor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">teacher</hi>: veritatis, Amm 30, 5, 9; <cit><quote lang="la">22, 4, 1: adulandi professores jam docti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non obscurus professor atque auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 36</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:13:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 13, 6</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a physician</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 4</bibl>; cf. Cod. 10, 52.</sense></entryFree>
professorius: <entryFree id="n38614" type="main" key="pro^fesso_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfessōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>professor</etym>, <sense id="n38614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a public teacher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">professorial</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">professoria lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
professus: <entryFree id="n38615" type="main" key="pro^fessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfessus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from profiteor</entryFree>
profestus: <entryFree id="n38616" type="main" key="pro^festus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏ-festus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pro-festus; cf. profanus</etym>. <sense id="n38616.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">non-festival</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not kept as a holiday</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common;</hi> of days, <hi rend="ital">workingdays</hi>: profestum diem dicebant qui festus non erat, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=252" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 252</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">profesti dies a festivitate vacui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 434, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut carpentis, festis profestisque diebus, per urbem vectemur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 144</bibl>: pejor, qui profestis diebus ageret, quod feriatis deberet, Cato ap <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 8, § 40</bibl>. luces, <hi rend="ital">working-days</hi>, Hor C. 4, 15, 25; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:S. 2:2:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profestum facere est tamquam profanum facere, id est facere, quod feriis facere non licet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=253" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 253</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n38616.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, like profanus, <hi rend="ital">uninitiated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncultivated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uneducated</hi> (post-class.): profestum et profanum vulgus, Gell. praef. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
proficienter: <entryFree id="n38617" type="main" key="pro_fi^ci^enter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōfĭcĭenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. proficio <sense id="n38617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
proficio: <entryFree id="n38618" type="main" key="pro_fi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōfĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, fectum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n38618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [pro-facio], <hi rend="ital">to go forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gain ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make progress.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38618.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cum quinqueremis sola non proficeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 1, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38618.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to go on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make progress; to profit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">derive advantage; to perform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi>, etc. (class.; cf. procedo). </sense><sense id="n38618.3" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">si nihil in oppugnatione oppidi profecisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi diligentiā nostrorum nihil his rebus profici posse intellexerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus multitudine telorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci opportunitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antesignani tantum profecere, ut pellerent omnes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum profecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 10, 1</bibl></cit>: si modo in philosophiā aliquid profecimus, <hi rend="ital">have made any progress</hi>, Cic. <pb n="1458" /> <cb n="PROF" /> Off. 3, 8, 37: <cit><quote lang="la">ea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:de Or. 2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Of the sick, <hi rend="ital">to get better</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quidquam profecerint, Cael. Aur Acut. 2, 10, 71 proficiens aegrotus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib. 2:11:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 81</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n38618.4" n="B" level="2"> Of manim subjects, <hi rend="ital">to grow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">id (vitis genus) quod umore proficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proficiente pretio,</quote> <trans><tr>rising</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 6, § 57</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed etiam ad summam profectum aliquid puto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam nihil proficiebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 30, § 122</bibl></cit>.—In a bad sense: <cit><quote lang="la">proficere in pejus,</quote> <trans><tr>to become worse and worse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Tim. 3, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38618.5" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to be useful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serviceable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advantageous</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to effect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplish; to help</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contribute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduce</hi> (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">prosum) ea suo quaeque loco, ubi plurimum proficere et valere possent, collocabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:37:139" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 37, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla res tantum ad dicendum proficit, quantum scriptio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 24, 92</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Liv 3, 61: profectura aliquid tum tua verba puta, Ov P. 3, 1, 138: aut nihil in melius tot rerum proficit usus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:18" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 18</bibl></cit>.—Of remedies: <cit><quote lang="la">radice vel herbā Proficiente nihil,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 150</bibl></cit>; nec alia res celerius proficit, <hi rend="ital">is of service</hi>, Plin 27, 11, 72, § <cit><quote lang="la">96: axungia proficit ad strumas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 28, 9, 37, § 140</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">pirorum ligni cinis contra fungos efficacius proficit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 23, 7, 62, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix anethi vel in febribus proficit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 20, 23, 98, § 260</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum proficiet illud demonstrare, quemadmodum scripsisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:41:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 41, 120</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōfĭcĭenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">successfully</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Aug Ep. 80: incedere, Hil. Trin. 1, 22; Cassiod in Psa. 133, 2.</sense></entryFree>
proficisco: <entryFree id="n38619" type="main" key="pro^fi^cisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfĭcisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. proficiscor <sense id="n38619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
proficiscor: <entryFree id="n38620" type="main" key="pro^fi^ciscor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfĭciscor</orth>, <itype>fectus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n38620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [profacio, facesso, faciscor; orig., to make, i. e. put one's self forward; hence], <hi rend="ital">to set out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">start</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">march</hi>, <hi rend="ital">travel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depart</hi>, etc. (class.; cf. progredior). </sense><sense id="n38620.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">proficisci ad dormiendum,</quote> <trans><tr>to go to sleep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:58:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 58, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad somnum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 30, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad sedes inquirendas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:4:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pabulatum frumentatumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:10" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsidio alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,011:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Iph. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:45 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 45 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eam domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:27:section=69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 27, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Puteolos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Illyricum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 11, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:9:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 9, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in expeditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 103:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 103, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Volscos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 6, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc in pistrinum rectā viā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra quosdam barbaros, Nep Eum 3, 5: Cyprum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Corinthum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Genabum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 34, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Circeios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 39</bibl></cit>: jussit proficisci exilium quovis gentium, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 185, 6</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v 599 Rib.): Jovinus eadem loca profectus, Amm 27, 8, 2.—With <hi rend="ital">supine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">porro proficiscor quaesitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 98</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">proficisci,</quote> <trans><tr>to make a journey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:52" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab urbe,</quote> <trans><tr>to set out</tr>, <tr>depart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Antio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex castris,</quote> <trans><tr>to break up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e castris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 79:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 79, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">portu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:3:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 37, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Formiano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38620.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be going</hi> or <hi rend="ital">about to go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to intend to go to</hi> a place, <hi rend="ital">to start</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">potin' ut me ire, quo profectus sum, sinas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu profectus alio fueras, Ter Eun. 2, 2, 49: cum proficisceretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38620.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38620.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc proficiscemur ad reliqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:5:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 5, § 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38620.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38620.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To set out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut inde oratio mea proficiscatur, unde, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnis haec quaestio ab eo proficiscatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:8:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 8, 23</bibl></cit>;
