<cit><quote lang="la">a philosophiā profectus Xenophon scripsit historiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:14:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 14, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei proficiscendum est ab omni mundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:22:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 22, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38620.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To come forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">originate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnia officia a principiis naturae proficiscantur, ab iisdem necesse est proficisci ipsam sapientiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 7, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 12, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 6, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsis initiis profecta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 21, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex medicinā nihil oportet putare proficisci, nisi quod ad corporis utilitatem spectet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:38:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 38, 68</bibl></cit>: quaecumque a me ornamenta ad te proficiscentur, <hi rend="ital">shall pass from me to you</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">you shall receive from me</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 19, 2</bibl>: omnia quae a me profecta <cb n="PROF" /> sunt in te, tibi accidisse gratissime, <hi rend="ital">all you have received from me</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut plura a parente proficisci non potuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui a Zenone profecti sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>who have proceeded from him</tr>, <tr>his disciples</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes ab Aristotele profecti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35, 61</bibl></cit>.—So, to express descent (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Tyriā de gente profecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 51</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfĭcisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <hi rend="ital">to set out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go</hi>, etc. (anteclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam proficisco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 19</bibl></cit>; hortatur hominem, quam primum proficisceret, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 471, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proficuus: <entryFree id="n38621" type="main" key="pro_fi^cu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōfĭcŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n38621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj</hi> [proficio], <hi rend="ital">beneficial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advantageous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conducive</hi> (late Lat): <cit><quote lang="la">quibus mora potest esse proficua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 1, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
profiteor: <entryFree id="n38622" type="main" key="pro^fi^te^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfĭtĕor</orth>, <itype>fessus</itype>, <sense id="n38622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">2</hi> (old form of the <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> PROFITEREI, and of the <hi rend="ital">imper.</hi> PROFITEMINO, several times in the Tab. Her, in Haubold, Mon. Leg. p. 99 sq.), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [pro-fateor], <hi rend="ital">to declare publicly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to own freely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to acknowledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confess openly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profess</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38622.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n38622.2" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque vis tuā voluntate ipse profiteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita libenter confitetur, ut non solum fateri, sed etiam profiteri videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fateor atque etiam profiteor et prae me fero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 5, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38622.3" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">profiteri et in medium proferre aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:23:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 23, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur ea non profitenda putabas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 129</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38622.4" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">obj. clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">profitentur Carnutes, se nullum periculum recusare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N D. 1, 5, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38622.5" n="d" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de parricidio professum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de semet professo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38622.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38622.7" n="A" level="2"> Profiteri se aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to declare one's self</hi> or <hi rend="ital">profess to be</hi> something: <cit><quote lang="la">profiteri se grammaticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; Poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 26, 42</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">profiteri se patrem infantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se legatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se candidatum consulatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">professus amicum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">esse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">triduo me jure consultum esse profitebor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 13, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me omnium provinciarum defensorem esse profitebor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:93:section=217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 93, § 217</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38622.8" n="B" level="2"> Profiteri aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to profess</hi> an art, science, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">profiteri philosophiam,</quote> <trans><tr>to declare one's self a philosopher</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:29:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 29, 71</bibl></cit>; medicinam, <hi rend="ital">to profess medicine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to practise as a physician</hi>, Cels. praef.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 42</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:531" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 531</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem non professam apud nos tenemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 341" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 341</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: profiteri, <hi rend="ital">to be a teacher</hi> or <hi rend="ital">professor</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnes qui profitentur, audiero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Ep 2:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep 2, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">translatus est in Siciliam, ubi nunc profitetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 4:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 11, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38622.9" n="C" level="2"> Profiteri indicium, <hi rend="ital">to give evidence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make a deposition</hi> against accomplices: <cit><quote lang="la">multis hortantibus indicium profitetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 35, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Afr 55" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Afr 55</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:6:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 6, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 16, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summum supplicium decernebatur, ni professus indicium foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38622.10" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To offer freely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propose voluntarily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to promise</hi>: quis profitetur? <hi rend="ital">who volunteers?</hi> Plaut Capt. 3, 1, 20: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad eam rem adjutorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego vero tibi profiteor atque polliceor eximium et singulare meum studium in omni genere officii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vos in eam rem operam vestram profitemini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:53:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 53, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Varro profitetur se alterā die ad colloquium venturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumunt gentiles arma professa manus,</quote> <trans><tr>arms that promise a combat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:198" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 198</bibl></cit>: magna, Hor A. P. 14; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:351" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 351</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38622.11" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To disclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">display</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make a show of;</hi> dolorem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:5:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sola Jovem Semele vidit Jovis ora professum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitate viros cultum formamque professos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> A A. 3, 433</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38622.12" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To make a public statement</hi> or <hi rend="ital">return of</hi> any thing (as of one's name, property, business, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">censum (one's estate),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Tab. Her. in Haubold, Mon. Leg. p. 99 sq. (q. v.): ut aratores jugera sationum suarum profiterentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:15:section=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 15, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud decemviros, quantum habeat praedae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:22:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 22, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">greges ovium ad publicanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum, Liv 4, 12: furtum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 341" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 341</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem alienam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 341" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 341</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem apud publicanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 359" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 359</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:16:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 4, 16, § 12</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne decipiat (publicanus) profiteri volentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:19:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 4, 19, § 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 2, 3</bibl> and 5: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <trans><tr>to give in one's name</tr>, <tr>announce one's self</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 18</bibl></cit>; <cb n="PROF" /> also without <hi rend="ital">nomen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catilina prohibitus erat petere consulatum, quod intra legitimos dies profiteri nequiverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam et quaesturam petentes, quos indignos judicavit, profiteri vetuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:92:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 92, 3</bibl></cit>: professae (sc. feminae), i. e. <hi rend="ital">common prostitutes</hi>, who had to give in their names to the aedile, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:866" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 866</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in his nomen suum profitetur,</quote> <trans><tr>among these he reckons himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏ-fessus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, in passive signif., <hi rend="ital">known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confessed</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">culpa professa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:4:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.—Ex or de professo, <hi rend="ital">openly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avowedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intentionally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">professedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ex professo eam (potentiam) non petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 14:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir ex professo mollis, Macr S. 2, 9.—De professo (postclass.): ac ne id quidem de professo audet,</quote> <trans><tr>openly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 274, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proflamen: <entryFree id="n38623" type="gloss" key="pro_fla_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-flāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n38623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flamen's substitute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proflamen</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2270</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proflatus: <entryFree id="n38624" type="main" key="pro_fla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-flātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pro-flo</etym>. <sense id="n38624.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a blowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breeze</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">aestivo proflatu refrigerari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 9, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38624.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a snoring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proflatu terrebat equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:320" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 320</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proflictus: <entryFree id="n38625" type="main" key="pro_flictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-flictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 2. profligo.</entryFree>
profligatio: <entryFree id="n38626" type="main" key="pro_fli_ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōflīgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. profligo</etym>. <sense id="n38626.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum profligatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Per. Od. 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38626.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A settling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collection</hi>: debitorum, Cod. Th. 6, 30, 10; Novell. Th. 2, 26 <hi rend="ital">pr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
profligator: <entryFree id="n38627" type="main" key="pro_fli_ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōflīgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a spendthrift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prodigal</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ganeo et profligator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ennod.</author> Dict. 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
profligatus: <entryFree id="n38628" type="main" key="pro_fli_ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōflīgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from 1, profligo.</entryFree>
profligo: <entryFree id="n38629" type="main" key="pro_fli_go1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-flīgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dash to the ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cast down utterly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overcome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conquer</hi> (class.; syn.: sterno, prosterno). </sense><sense id="n38629.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicos profligare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 14, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the warriors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem virorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:400" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 400</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38629.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38629.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantas opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undique se suosque profligante fortunā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:5:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38629.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To overwhelm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crush</hi> in spirit: <cit><quote lang="la">quanti illum maerore afflictum esse et profligatum putatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38629.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bring almost to an end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to almost finish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despatch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum commissum ac profligatum conficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:40:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 40, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profligato fere Samnitium bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 29, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 2, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">profligatum bellum ac paene sublatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profligata jam haec, et paene ad exitum adducta quaestio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ad perniciem profligata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperans, ante Vitellii adventum profligari plurimum posse,</quote> <trans><tr>that it would be brought nearly to an end</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profligaverat bellum Judaicum Vespasianus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; Flor 2, 15, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:7:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 31, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:13:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">profligatis in Africā rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:8:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:3:2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum profligatum sit,</quote> <trans><tr>how far advanced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:4:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 4, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:3:20" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 3, 20</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōflīgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n38629.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Wretched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">miserable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vile</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. perditus): senatoria judicia perdita profligataque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38629.7" n="B" level="2"> In a moral sense, <hi rend="ital">corrupt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissolute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abandoned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profligate</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tu omnium mortalium profligatissime ac perditissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:26:section=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 26, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ad perniciem profligata atque perdita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profligatissimus quisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 35</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38629.8" n="C" level="2"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">advanced</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">profligatae aetatis (homo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ot. 2:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ot. 2, 2</bibl></cit> (al. Vit. Beat. 29, 2).—In <hi rend="ital">neutr. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in profligato esse,</quote> <trans><tr>to be almost ended</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:5:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38630" type="main" key="pro_fli_go2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-flīgo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">proflictae res,</quote> <trans><tr>cast down</tr>, <tr>ruined</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:5:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proflo: <entryFree id="n38631" type="main" key="pro_flo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-flo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to blow forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breathe out.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38631.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">leo proflat ferus ore calores, Q. Cic. poët. ap. Aus. Ecl.: flammas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:573" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 573</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:571" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 571</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectore sanguineos rivos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:266" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 266</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38631.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to melt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">liquefy</hi> by blowing (postAug.): massa proflatur in primis, mox in <pb n="1459" /> <cb n="PROF" /> proflatum additur, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 9, 20, § 97</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n38631.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to blow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">breathe out</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">noctem Tartaream pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:435" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toto proflabat pectore somnum,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>was snoring</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 326</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iras,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>to puff and blow</tr>, <tr>to fret</tr>, <tr>fume</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 4, 5, § 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38631.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To puff out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nares,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 193, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
profluens: <entryFree id="n38632" type="main" key="pro_flu^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōflŭens</orth>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from profluo.</entryFree>
profluenter: <entryFree id="n38633" type="main" key="pro_flu^enter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōflŭenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. profluo, <sense id="n38633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
profluentia: <entryFree id="n38634" type="hapax" key="pro_flu^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōflŭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>profluo</etym>, <sense id="n38634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flowing forth</hi> (trop.): <cit><quote lang="la">inanis quaedam profluentia loquendi,</quote> <trans><tr>a stream of words</tr>, <tr>fluency</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 23, 81</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
profluo: <entryFree id="n38635" type="main" key="pro_flu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-flŭo</orth>, <itype>xi, xum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n38635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to flow forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">along</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38635.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mosa profluit ex monte Vogeso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si lacrimae ab oculis et pituita a naribus profluent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:7:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umor profluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 25</bibl></cit>: sanguis profluens, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:16:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 16, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:4:17" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 15, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per fossas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:44:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 44, 100</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38635.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38635.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cause a running</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravedo profluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38635.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be relaxed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">videndum est an adstrictum corpus sit, an profluat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si venter profluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38635.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to flow forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">issue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae ab hoc fonte profluant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=62" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 62</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus ore sermo melle dulcior profluebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 33, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem ab his fontibus profluxi ad hominum famam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: ad incognitas artes, <hi rend="ital">to proceed to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fall</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hit upon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 26</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōflŭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">flowing along</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38635.6" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua profluens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38635.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōflŭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. aqua), <hi rend="ital">running water</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in profluentem deferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:50:149" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 50, 149</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 13, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:9" default="NO">4, 12, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38635.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech, <hi rend="ital">flowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fluent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus sermonis affert non liquidum, non fusum ac profluens, sed exile, aridum, concisum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 38, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profluens et perennis loquacitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 48, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profluens atque expedita celeritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:61:220" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 61, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profluens quiddam habuit Carbo et canorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manuum suarum profluentissima largitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> in Psa. 104</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōflŭenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">flowingly;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">easily</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ergo omnia profluenter, absolute, prospere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:18:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 18, 53</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, of speech, <hi rend="ital">more fluently</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">profluentius exsequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:32" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
profluus: <entryFree id="n38636" type="main" key="pro_flu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōflŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>profluo</etym>, <sense id="n38636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flowing forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">streaming</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">recessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
profluvium: <entryFree id="n38637" type="main" key="pro_flu^vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōflŭvĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38637.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a flowing forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a flowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flow</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis per nares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:33:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 42, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 6, 17, § 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38637.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38637.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Looseness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flux</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diarrhœa</hi>: si corpus astrictum est, digerendum esse; si profluvio laborat, continendum, Cels. praef.—</sense><sense id="n38637.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Monthly flux</hi>, <hi rend="ital">menses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 15, 13, § 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38637.4" n="C" level="2"> Genitale, <hi rend="ital">flow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 14, 12, § 61</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also: geniturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 22, 40, § 83</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
profluvius: <entryFree id="n38638" type="main" key="pro_flu^vi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōflŭvĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n38638.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Flowing;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">fluctuating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconstant</hi>: profluvia fides, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 699</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n38638.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōflŭvĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, for profluvium, <hi rend="ital">a flux</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 17, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 38, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
profor: <entryFree id="n38639" type="main" key="pro^for"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏ-for</orth>, <itype>fātus, 1</itype> (<sense id="n38639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> profarier, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 939), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to say</hi> or <hi rend="ital">speak out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to say</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speak</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n38639.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: veteres Casmenas cascam rem volo profari, <hi rend="ital">tell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 28</bibl> Müll.: quod jam et mehe Piget paternum nomen, maternum pudet Profari, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 424, 4</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 145 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">pudor prohibebat plura profari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum breviter Dido, vultum demissa, profatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:561" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 561</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et sic accensa profatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus ille profatur: Forsitan, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera profari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic ille profatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamore magno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:211" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 211</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38639.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to foretell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophesy</hi>: quando dies adveniet, quem profata Morta est, Liv. And. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:16:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 16, 11</bibl> (acc. to Hom. Odyss. 2, 99): <cit><quote lang="la">Pythia quae tripodi a Phoebi lauroque profatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:739" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 739</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:112" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 112</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Delio profante,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 1</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfātum</orth>. <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a statement</hi>, <cb n="PROF" /> <hi rend="ital">proposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">axiom</hi> (post-class.): <foreign lang="greek">a)ciw/mata</foreign>, quae M. Varro alias profata, alias proloquia appellat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:8:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 8, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
profringo: <entryFree id="n38640" type="hapax" key="pro^fringo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏ-fringo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>frango</etym>, <sense id="n38640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to break up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inarata,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to plough</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:512" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 512</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
profuga: <entryFree id="n38641" type="main" key="pro^fu^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfŭga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, collat. form of profugus, II. B., q. v.</entryFree>
profugio: <entryFree id="n38642" type="main" key="pro^fu^gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏ-fŭgĭo</orth> (with first syll. long, <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 2, 477</bibl>), <itype>fūgi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n38642.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flee before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fly from</hi> any thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Phocaeorum Velut profugit execrata civitas Agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:18" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspectum conversationemque civium suorum profugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Polyb. 17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Polyb. 17</bibl></cit> (36), 4: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes suas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:2:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 977" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 977</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38642.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">run away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">escape</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">domo profugiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedibus Hadrumetum profugerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Babyloniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:12:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cirtam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 21, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:13" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istinc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 14, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex oppido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Britanniam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:89:306" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 89, 306</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vi prope justorum armorum profugisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:22:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 22, 50</bibl></cit> B. and K. (Klotz, vim): <cit><quote lang="la">in exsilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:32:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 32, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex proelio in provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e carcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:19:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 19, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:30:5" default="NO">2, 30, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38642.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to flee for succor</hi> to one, <hi rend="ital">take refuge</hi> with one (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">se profugere ad Brutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Ciceronem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 74:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 74, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:8:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 8, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
profugus: <entryFree id="n38643" type="main" key="pro^fu^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfŭgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>profugio</etym>, <sense id="n38643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that flees</hi> or <hi rend="ital">has fled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fugitive</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.; cf. fugitivus). </sense><sense id="n38643.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">profugus domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Peloponneso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad rebelles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 57</bibl></cit>.—Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">boves profugae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:1:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:57" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taurus profugus altaribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 56</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 506</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiridates regni profugus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis vinculorum (Hannibalis) profugus,</quote> <trans><tr>escaped from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 28, 29, § 104</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38643.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fleeing hither and thither</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vagabond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wandering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsettled</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">profugi Scythae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scythes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 14, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 4, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38643.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">that flees from his native country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fugitive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exiled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibal patriā profugus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trojani, qui profugi incertis sedibus vagabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fato profugus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 627</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38643.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏ-fŭgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfŭga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n38643.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A fugitive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banished person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exile</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">profugus patriam deseras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profugo affer opem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:9:6" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 9, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 6, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi alieni profugae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 175, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 622</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n38643.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An apostate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reus suae religionis aut profugus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> 35, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
profundatus: <entryFree id="n38644" type="spur" key="pro^funda_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfundātus</orth>, a false read. for probe fundata, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 44</bibl>; v. Ritschl ad h. l.</entryFree>
profunde: <entryFree id="n38645" type="main" key="pro^funde_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfundē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. profundus <sense id="n38645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
profunditas: <entryFree id="n38646" type="main" key="pro^fundi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfundĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>profundus</etym>, <sense id="n38646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">depth</hi> (post - class.). </sense><sense id="n38646.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporum tres sunt dimensiones, longitudo, latitudo, profunditas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 2, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38646.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">vastness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immensity</hi>, Hadrian. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Sat. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prudentiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38646.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Depth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intensity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">darkness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebrarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 20, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
profundo: <entryFree id="n38647" type="main" key="pro_^fundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō^-fundo</orth>, <itype>fūdi, fūsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pour out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shed copiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to flow</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38647.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem suum profundere omnem cupit, dummodo profusum hujus ante videat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem pro patriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:19:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 19, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 30, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim lacrimarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:14:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 14, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 154</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 679</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 541" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 541</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem ex oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 60, 79, § 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina deo tamquam sitienti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquas sub mensas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 5, § 26</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to burst</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gush forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimae se subito profuderunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 11, 7, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38647.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38647.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To stretch at full length</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prostrate</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">cum somnus membra profudit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:757" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 757</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipites profusae in terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:744" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 744</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: profusus, abjectus jacens. Pacuvius: profusus gemitu,<cb n="PROF" />  murmure, <hi rend="ital">stretched at full length</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=228" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 228</bibl> Müll. (Trag. Rel. v. 321 Rib.). —</sense><sense id="n38647.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pour</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cast out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi> (class.): posticā parte profudit, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 217, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(puerum) ex alvo matris natura profudit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 401</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ex ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectore voces,</quote> <trans><tr>to pour forth</tr>, <tr>utter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 23, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:8:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 8, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38647.5" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pour forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rush forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out;</hi> of bees: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se nova profundent examina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of archers: omnis multitudo sagittariorum se profudit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 93</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of luxuriant plants: ea, quae se nimium profuderunt,</quote> <trans><tr>have shot out</tr>, <tr>sent out shoots</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:21:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 21, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profundit se supra modum numerus palmitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:24:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 24, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38647.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cast</hi> or <hi rend="ital">throw away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventis verba profundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:931" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 931</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae si non profundere ac perdere videbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 5, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38647.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38647.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To throw away.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38647.9" n="a" level="4"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">spend uselessly; to lavish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissipate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squander</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">profundat, perdat, pereat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:67:section=155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 67, § 155</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrimonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunias in res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 16, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38647.10" n="b" level="4"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">to spend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacrifice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo pecuniam, sed vitam etiam profundere pro patriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 24, 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38647.11" n="c" level="4"> Esp., of life, <hi rend="ital">to yield</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Marc. 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si pateretur natura, vel denas animas profundere praestabat in pugnā, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 10, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritum in acie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:3:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38647.12" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pour out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vent; to expend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employ; to set forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes profudi vires animi atque ingenii mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res universas,</quote> <trans><tr>to set forth</tr>, <tr>explain</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 27, 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38647.13" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pour itself forth</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to rush forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptates cum inclusae diutius, subito se nonnumquam profundunt atque eiciunt universae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:31:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 31, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si totum se ille in me profudisset,</quote> <trans><tr>had wholly poured himself out to me</tr>, <tr>had been liberal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in questus flebiles sese in vestibulo curiae profuderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 20, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏ-fūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n38647.14" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">spread out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hanging down</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">cauda profusa usque ad calces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi coma et cauda profusior,</quote> <trans><tr>longer</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38647.15" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38647.16" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Lavish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extravagant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profuse</hi> (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">prodigus): perditus ac profusus nepos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 12, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:7:section=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 7, § 20</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alieni appetens, sui profusus,</quote> <trans><tr>lavish of his own</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul ad jacturam temporis ventum est, profusissimi in eo, cujus unius honesta avaritia est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 3:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—Of things abstr. and concr.: <cit><quote lang="la">profusis sumptibus vivere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 30, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profusa luxuria in aedificiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:33:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 33, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38647.17" n="2" level="3"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">liberal</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">mens profusa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:91" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:38:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 38, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38647.18" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Costly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expensive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amare profusas epulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:36:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 36, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38647.19" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Immoderate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excessive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extravagant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">profusa hilaritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:7:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus jocandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 29, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 52</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">profusissima libido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 53</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfūsē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n38647.20" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">lavishly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extravagantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profusely</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">aedes profuse exstructa,</quote> <trans><tr>at an immoderate expense</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 72</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">festos et solemnes dies profusissime celebrabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 75</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38647.21" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38647.22" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">In disorder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confusedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul obstitit profuse tendentibus suis in castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38647.23" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Immoderately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excessively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">profuse prolixeque laudare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo profusius sumptui deditus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 13, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
profundus: <entryFree id="n38648" type="main" key="pro^fundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏ-fundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n38648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vast</hi> (class.; syn. altus). </sense><sense id="n38648.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare profundum et immensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 4, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per inane profundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:614" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 614</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acheron,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:978" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 978</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Danubius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fornax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:95" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae foramen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:6:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque hiavit humus multa, vasta, et profunda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 37</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Pan. Constant. 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">profundissimus libidinum gurges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:43:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 43, 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38648.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfundum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">depth.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38648.3" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in profundo (aquae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:14:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 14, 48</bibl></cit> <pb n="1460" /> <cb n="PROG" /> 4, 23, 64: <cit><quote lang="la">maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:84" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">immensa ac profunda camporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38648.4" n="b" level="4"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38648.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The depths of the sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the deep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the sea</hi> (class.): ex profundo molem ad caelum erigit, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:35:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 35, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jecissem ipse me potius in profundum, ut ceteros conservarem, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:20:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 20, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profundo Vela dabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 263</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vastum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:314" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 314</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:246" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 246</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indomitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:11:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 11, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater ipse profundi,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>Neptune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:606" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 606</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genitor profundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pamphylium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profundi imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:49" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:439" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 439</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 197</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38648.6" n="(b)" level="5"> In comic. lang., <hi rend="ital">an abyss</hi>, meaning <hi rend="ital">the stomach</hi>, in a lusus verbb. with fundus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 79</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38648.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38648.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Thick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dense</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post - class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">Erebi nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ursi villis profundioribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38648.9" n="2" level="3"> Like altus, <hi rend="ital">high</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">caelum profundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 4, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:478" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 478</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">altitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38648.10" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfundum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">height</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">altum caeli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 719</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38648.11" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">In a great quantity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlimited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without stint</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">merum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:262" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 262</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38648.12" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of the underworld</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infernal</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Manes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chaos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:401" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 401</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter, i. e. Pluto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:615" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 615</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juno, = Proserpina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38648.13" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38648.14" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Deep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bottomless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boundless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immoderate</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">profundae libidines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:21:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 21, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 81:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 81, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupido imperii et divitiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:61:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 61, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 2, 5, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditas confundendi omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:125:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 125, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">securitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> Pan. Constant. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profundissimā pace florere (=summā),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Pan. Maxim. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:831" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 831</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote
