lang="la">tempestas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Achill. 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:2:26" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immensusque ruit profundo Pindarus ore,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>with inexhaustible copiousness of expression</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum me somnus profundus in imum barathrum demergit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 125 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in profundam ruinam cupidinis se praecipitare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>, p. 202, 1.—</sense><sense id="n38648.15" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Deep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unknown</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">in profundo esse,</quote> <trans><tr>to be unknown</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38648.16" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfun-dum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a depth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abyss</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in profundo veritatem penitus abstrudere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Democritus (dixit) in profundo veritatem esse demersam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in profundum ultimarum miseriarum abjectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:10:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immergere aliquem miserabiliter profundo cladium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 6, 9</bibl></cit>, ext. 7: <cit><quote lang="la">in profundum injuriarum et turpitudinis decidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:9:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>, ext. 2; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de profundis clamavi ad te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:129:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 129, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfun-dē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">deeply</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">in bibendo profundius nares mergere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 66, § 165</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Osee, 9, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
profuse: <entryFree id="n38649" type="main" key="pro^fu_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfūsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. profundo, <sense id="n38649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
profusio: <entryFree id="n38650" type="main" key="pro^fu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>profundo</etym>, <sense id="n38650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pouring out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shedding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effusion</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n38650.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">profusio sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvi,</quote> <trans><tr>looseness</tr>, <tr>diarrhœa</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 21</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n38650.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a pouring out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">libation</hi> of wine, milk, water, blood, and other fluids on graves; <number>plur.</number>, Inscr. Marin. Frat. Arv. p. 562; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 147, 182</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">or in offering sacrifices: si focos odorati aut veteris vini profusione madefecerint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38650.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">prodigality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profusion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infinitae sumptuum profusiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10 praef.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clementiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
profusor: <entryFree id="n38651" type="main" key="pro^fu_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfūsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a squanderer</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
profusus: <entryFree id="n38652" type="main" key="pro^fu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏfūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from profundo.</entryFree>
progemmans: <entryFree id="n38653" type="main" key="pro_gemmans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-gemmans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [gemmo], <sense id="n38653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">budding forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">budding</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">palmis progemmantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:27:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 27, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
progener: <entryFree id="n38654" type="main" key="pro_ge^ner"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-gĕner</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n38654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a granddaughter's husband</hi>: progenerum appellat avus neptis suae virum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=228" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 228</bibl> Müll.; cf.: socer dicitur uxoris meae pater: ego illius sum gener: socer magnus dicitur uxoris meae avus: ego sum illius progener. Item prosocrus mihi uxoris meae avia est: ego illius sum progener. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 19</bibl>: nihil illi profuisset <cb n="PROG" /> puer Agrippa et Tiberius progener, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 21:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 21, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
progeneratio: <entryFree id="n38655" type="main" key="pro_ge^ne^ra_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōgĕnĕrātio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>progenero</etym>, <sense id="n38655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an engendering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procreation</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mularum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 43, 68, § 167</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:263" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 28, 67, § 263</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diomedis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 651</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
progenero: <entryFree id="n38656" type="main" key="pro_ge^ne^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-gĕnĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to beget</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generate</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Cæs.): nec imbellem feroces Progenerant aquilae columbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 31</bibl></cit>.—Of bees: <cit><quote lang="la">fetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 16, 16, § 46</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (vituli) ex his progenerantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 28</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">si res exigit, ut plurimi mares progenerandi sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:4" default="NO">9, 14, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6" default="NO">6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrueles, id est qui ex duobis fratribus progenerati sunt, Gai,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, 10</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut progenerare possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
progenetrix: <entryFree id="n38657" type="main" key="pro_ge^ne_^trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōgĕnē^trix</orth>, v. progenitrix.</entryFree>
progeniculo: <entryFree id="n38658" type="gloss" key="pro^ge^ni^cu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏgĕnĭcŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype> <etym>pro-geniculum</etym>, <sense id="n38658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fall on the knees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to beg on one's knees</hi>: progeniculo, <foreign lang="greek">gounou=mai</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.: progeniculat, <foreign lang="greek">gonupetei=</foreign>, ib.</sense></entryFree>
progenies: <entryFree id="n38659" type="main" key="pro_ge^ni^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōgĕnĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype> (archaic <sense id="n38659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> progenii, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:14:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 14, 13</bibl>; and id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 490, 6</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>progigno</etym>, <hi rend="ital">descent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lineage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">race</hi>, <hi rend="ital">family.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38659.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in abstracto (very rare but class.): progeniem vestram usque ab avo atque atavo proferens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquitas quo propius aberat ab ortu et divinā progenie, hoc melius, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:12:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 12, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:24:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 24, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutem, non progeniem quaeri oportere (preceded by qui modo esset Herculis stirpe generatus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">progeniem sed enim Trojano a sanguine duci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 19</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n38659.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in concr. </sense><sense id="n38659.3" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Descendants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">posterity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offspring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">progeny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a son</hi> or <hi rend="ital">daughter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a child</hi> (the predom. signification of the word; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: proles, suboles), Epitaphs of the Scipios: veteres, qui se progeniem deorum esse dicebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Priamum tantā progenie (i.e. quinquaginta filiis) orbatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:35:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 35, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">progenies mea, Claudia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 14, 33</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Sarpedon, mea progenies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 470</bibl></cit>: Bacchum Progeniem negat esse Jovis, Ov M. 4, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 16, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">progenies quoque, ut Apollo ac Diana Latonae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex magnā progenie liberorum (preceded by ex tantā stirpe liberūm),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se matura levabit progenies (avium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:84" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 84</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">duces ducumque progenies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Polyb. 11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Polyb. 11</bibl></cit> (30), 4.—</sense><sense id="n38659.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A generation</hi> of men (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">una,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 10, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 34, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38659.5" n="c" level="4"> Of animals, <hi rend="ital">offspring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">young</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 414</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:1" default="NO">7, 9, 1</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis progenies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:9:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 9, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38659.6" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of poems, as offsprings of the poet's mind (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">stirps haec progeniesque mea est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:14:14" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 14, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
progenitor: <entryFree id="n38660" type="main" key="pro_ge^ni^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōgĕnĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the founder of a family</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an ancestor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">progenitor</hi> (very rare; not in Cic. or Cæs.): si tui veretur te progenitoris, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 497, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eurysthenes progenitor majorum suorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 7, 4</bibl></cit>: deūm, Val. Soran. ap. Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 319</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 9, 6, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Tim. 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
progenitrix: <entryFree id="n38661" type="main" key="pro_ge^ni_^trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōgĕnī^trix</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ē^trix</orth>), <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>progenitor</etym>, <sense id="n38661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the foundress</hi> or <hi rend="ital">general mother</hi> of a tribe or family, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 9, 6, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
progenitus: <entryFree id="n38662" type="main" key="pro_ge^ni^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōgĕnĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from progigno.</entryFree>
progermino: <entryFree id="n38663" type="main" key="pro_germi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-germĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n38663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shoot forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">germinate</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">surculus progerminat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:10:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:15:3" default="NO">4, 15, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
progero: <entryFree id="n38664" type="main" key="pro_ge^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-gĕro</orth>, <itype>gessi, gestum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n38664.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To carry forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to clear out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cast out</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">defunctas (apes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 18, 20, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formicae ova progerentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 35, 88, § 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fimum stabulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urcei, quibus oleum progeritur,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>is laded out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 50, 80</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38664.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To carry before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear in front</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 264, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinas effigies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 265, 11.</sense></entryFree>
progesto: <entryFree id="n38665" type="main" key="progesto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">progesto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>progero</etym>, <sense id="n38665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to carry before</hi> one (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nucleos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 185, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
progigno: <entryFree id="n38666" type="main" key="pro_gigno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-gigno</orth>, <itype>gĕnŭi, gĕnĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to beget</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">neque natus est neque progignetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> True. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in seminibus vis inest earum rerum, quae ex iis progignuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:56:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 56, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam terra parens Progenuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te saevae progenuere ferae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 38</bibl></cit>: sensum progignere acerbum,<cb n="PROG" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 670</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novos motus rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia nolebam ex me morem progigni malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 77</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Ritschl ad h. l.: Eurotae progignunt flumina myrtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 89</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prognare: <entryFree id="n38667" type="gloss" key="pro_gna_re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-gnārē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>gnarus</etym>, <sense id="n38667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">notoriously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">openly</hi>: invenimus prognare significare aperte, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=95" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 95</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
prognariter: <entryFree id="n38668" type="main" key="pro_gna_ri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-gnārĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very skilfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very expertly</hi> (ante-class.): prognariter armis Certare, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 150, 6</bibl> (Ann. v. 215 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">age, indica prognariter,</quote> <trans><tr>decisively</tr>, <tr>definitely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 39</bibl></cit> Ritschl <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 150, 4</bibl>, and 154, 30.</sense></entryFree>
prognatio: <entryFree id="n38669" type="main" key="pro_gna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōgnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prognatus</etym>, <sense id="n38669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a birth</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Diomedis Tydeique prognatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 651</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prognatus: <entryFree id="n38670" type="main" key="pro_gna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-gnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [gnatus, natus, from nascor], <sense id="n38670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">born</hi>, <hi rend="ital">descended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sprung</hi> from some one; of children or descendants. </sense><sense id="n38670.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: CORNELIVS LVCIVS SCIPIO BARBATVS GNAIVOD PATRE PROGNATVS, first Epitaph of the Scipios; SO, PROGNATVM PVBLIO, ninth Epitaph of the Scipios: corpore Tartarino (i. e. Chao) prognata Paluda virago (i. e. Minerva, Aër), Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=37" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 37</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 510 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">Sosiam Davo prognatum patre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a meo patre prognatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonis prognatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 78</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romulus deo prognatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 40</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōgnātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a child</hi>, <hi rend="ital">descendant</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">parentes, Patria et prognati,</quote> <trans><tr>children</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herculei prognati,</quote> <trans><tr>the descendants of Hercules</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 46</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Tantalo prognatus, Pelope natus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Atreus</tr>, <tr>grandson of Tantalus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:12:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Cimbris Teutonisque prognati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galli ab Dite patre prognati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: Venere, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 15, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Delphis prognatus Pythius Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:Bell. Punic. 2:20" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> Bell. Punic. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quali genere prognatus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Castor gaudet equis, ovo prognatus eodem Pugnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38670.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of plants, <hi rend="ital">sprung</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grown forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Peliaco quondam prognatae vertice pinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundines in palude prognatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 16, 23, § 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
progne: <entryFree id="n38671" type="main" key="Pro_^gne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Prō^gnē</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prō^cnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pro/knh</foreign>, <sense id="n38671.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of Pandion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sister of Philomela</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and wife of Tereus; she was changed into a swallow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natae ex Philomelā atque ex Progne hirundines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:440 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 440 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n38671.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <hi rend="ital">a swallow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:855" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 855</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:1:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 1, 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38671.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An island near Rhodes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 36, § 133</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prognosis: <entryFree id="n38672" type="greek" key="progno_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prognōsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pro/gnwsis</foreign>. <sense id="n38672.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Foreknowledge</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 12, 7, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38672.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., as med. t. t., <hi rend="ital">prognosis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forecast</hi>, in disease, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:8:112" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 8, 112</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prognosticon: <entryFree id="n38673" type="greek" key="pro^gno_sti^con"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏgnōstĭcon</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-um</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">prognwstiko/n</foreign>, <sense id="n38673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sign</hi> or <hi rend="ital">token</hi> of the future, <hi rend="ital">a prognostic;</hi> hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏgnōstĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the signs of the weather</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 9, 15</bibl>.— Also as the title of Cicero's translation of the <foreign lang="greek">*prognwstika/</foreign> of Aratus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:8:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 8, 13</bibl>; v. the fragments, id. Op. v. XI. p. 96 sqq. B. and K.</sense></entryFree>
programma: <entryFree id="n38674" type="greek" key="pro^gramma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏgramma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pro/gramma</foreign>, <sense id="n38674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proclamation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an edict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifesto</hi> (postclass.), Vulc. Av<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cassiod. 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 529</bibl>, n. 382.</sense></entryFree>
progredio: <entryFree id="n38675" type="main" key="pro_gre^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōgrĕdĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, v. progredior <sense id="n38675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
progredior: <entryFree id="n38676" type="main" key="pro_gre^di^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-grĕdĭor</orth>, <itype>gressus, 3</itype> (collat. form, acc. to the fourth conj., <sense id="n38676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> progrediri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 1, 9</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">imp.</hi> progredimino, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 70</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> collat. form, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [gradior], <hi rend="ital">to come</hi> or <hi rend="ital">go forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">march forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi> (class.; syn.: prodeo, proficiscor). </sense><sense id="n38676.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut regredi quam progredi mallent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quo hic gradietur, pariter progrediminor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 1, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 2, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedetemptim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:533" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 533</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:24:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 24, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longius a castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in locum iniquum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tridui viam progressi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 61</bibl>: ad Inalpinos cum exercitu, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obviam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n38676.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ad reliqua progrediar,</quote> <trans><tr>will proceed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:30:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 30, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procedere et progredi in virtute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:23:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 23, 64</bibl></cit>: cum autem progrediens confirmatur animus, agnoscit ille quidem naturae vim, sed ita ut progredi possit longius, id. <pb n="1461" /> <cb n="PROH" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 15, 43</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">longius progredi,</quote> <trans><tr>to go on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoad progredi potuerit feri hominis amentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videamus, quatenus amor in amicitiā progredi debeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinatio conjecturā nititur, ultra quam progredi non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:14:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 14, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">progredientibus aetatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:15:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 15, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulum aetate progressus,</quote> <trans><tr>advanced in age</tr>, <tr>become older</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in adulationem progressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo amentiae progressi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulum aliquid ultra primas litteras progressi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">incipientibus aut paulum progressis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 149</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōgressus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">advanced</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">progressā aetate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut progressior reverteretur anima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">progressioris aetatis sum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Josh. 23, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōgrĕdĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <hi rend="ital">to go forward</hi>, etc. (ante-class.): age, move te, in navem primus progredi, Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 473, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
progressio: <entryFree id="n38677" type="main" key="pro_gressi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōgressĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>progredior</etym>, <sense id="n38677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">progression;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">advancement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">progress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">growth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi> (a favorite word with Cicero). </sense><sense id="n38677.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rerum principia parva sunt, sed suis progressionibus usa augentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:21:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 21, 58</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 5, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">progressionem, virtutem persequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:7:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">progressio admirabilis ad omnem excellentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">progressionem facere ad virtutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:24:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 24, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 3, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38677.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., a figure of speech, <hi rend="ital">a progression</hi>, <hi rend="ital">climax</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a progressive strengthening of expressions</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 54, 206</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
progressor: <entryFree id="n38678" type="main" key="pro_gressor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōgressor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that goes forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advances</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Mus. 6:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Mus. 6, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
progressus: <entryFree id="n38679" type="main" key="pro_gressus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōgressus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <sense id="n38679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P.a.</hi>, from progredior.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38680" type="main" key="pro_gressus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōgressus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>progredior</etym>, <sense id="n38680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">progress</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n38680.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Antonium) Brutus progressu arcuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—Of the planets: <cit><quote lang="la">progressus et regressus constantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">progressum praecipitem, inconstantem reditum videt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 21, 3</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n38680.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">a jetty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mole</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 12, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38680.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38680.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Advancement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">progress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">growth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:17:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 17, 47</bibl></cit>: primo progressu, <hi rend="ital">at the first outset</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">at the very commencement</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 28, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in studiis progressus facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:19:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 19, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">progressus habere in Stoicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum progressum facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cat. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cat. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38680.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">progress</hi>, of events: <cit><quote lang="la">homo causas rerum videt, earumque progressus et quasi antecessiones non ignorat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
progubernator: <entryFree id="n38681" type="hapax" key="pro_gu^berna_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-gŭbernātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n38681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an under-pilot</hi>, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 536, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
progymnastes: <entryFree id="n38682" type="greek" key="pro^gymnastes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏgymnastes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">progumnasth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n38682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slave who performs gymnastic exercises before his master</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 83, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proh: <entryFree id="n38683" type="main" key="proh"><orth extent="full" lang="la">proh</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, v. 2. pro.</entryFree>
prohibeo: <entryFree id="n38684" type="main" key="pro^hi^be^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏ-hĭbĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 2</itype> (old forms, prohibessis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 141, 2</bibl>; Enn. ap. Prob. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 31</bibl> (Trag. v. 323 Vahl.): <sense id="n38684.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">prohibessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prohibessint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>habeo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to hold in front</hi>, i. e., </sense><sense id="n38684.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To hold back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep in check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ward off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">debar</hi> (class.; cf.: inhibeo, arceo). </sense><sense id="n38684.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.; usually constr. <hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi>, with <case>abl.</case>; alone or <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <case>abl.</case>; with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quominus</hi>, or an <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause;</hi> also with simple <hi rend="ital">acc.;</hi> less freq. with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, the <case>dat.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38684.3" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo illum ab illā prohibeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prohibete a vobis vim meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedones procul ab insulā Siciliā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:64:section=144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 64, § 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem a pugnā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a familiaritate, congressione, patrio jure et potestate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim hostium ab oppidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se suosque ab injuriā,</quote> <trans><tr>to restrain themselves</tr>, <tr>refrain from</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 28</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita prohibendo a delictis magis quam vindicando exercitum brevi confirmavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 45:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 45, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 4</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n38684.4" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: vim de classe, Lucil. ap. Non 528, 10.—</sense><sense id="n38684.5" n="3" level="3"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum suis finibus eos prohibent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itinere exercitum,</quote> <trans><tr>to impede its march</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem rapinis, pabulationibus populationibusque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case> without an object: non prohibere aquā profluente, <cb n="PROH" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:16:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 16, 52</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38684.6" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to withhold from one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aditum alicui, Auct. B. Afr. 31: captae prohibere nequiret Cum Poenos aquilae,</quote> <trans><tr>could not prevent the Carthaginians from capturing the standard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:27" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 27</bibl></cit> (but the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 12, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 44</bibl>, depends on the <case>acc.</case> object of prohibere; v. 7 infra).—</sense><sense id="n38684.7" n="5" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quominus;</hi> rarely with <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dii prohibeant, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:52:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 52, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tu id prohibere me potes, ne suspicer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 50</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod potuisti prohibere, ne fieret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:10:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne lustrum perficeret, mors prohibuit P. Furi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:43:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 43, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiemem credo adhuc prohibuisse, quo minus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prohibere quominus sumerent, non poterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:34" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si prohibere, quominus in unum coirent, non posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 35, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec, quin erumperet, ubi vellet, prohiberi poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 40, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38684.8" n="6" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui peregrinos urbibus uti prohibent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:11:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 11, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Bibulum exire domo prohibuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam se ad prohibenda circumdari opera Aequi parabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 28, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prohibuit migrari, Veios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:49:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 49, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prohibete jus de pecuniis dici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:18:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 18, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 20, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">audeat Canuleius proloqui, se delectum haberi prohibiturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 14, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Cimbros intra fines suos ingredi prohibuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 606</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38684.9" n="7" level="3"> With simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: Mars pater, ut tu morbos visos invisosque, viduertatem vastitudinemque ... prohibessis, defendas averruncesque, an old formula of prayer in <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 141</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque munitiones Caesaris prohibere poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus conatusque alicujus prohibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prohibenda maxime est ira in puniendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 25, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod uti prohibitum irem, quod in me esset, meo labori non parsi, Cato ap. Fest. s. v. parsi, p. 242 Müll.: prohibere comitia dicitur vitiare diem morbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=236" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 236</bibl></cit> ib.; Cato ap. Fest. l. l.: quod di prohibeant, <hi rend="ital">which may the gods forbid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">avert</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 36</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in the same sense: dii mala prohibeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: di, prohibete minas; <cit><quote lang="la">di, talem avertite casum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 265</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">deos quaeso, ut istaec prohibeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38684.10" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to forbid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prohibit</hi> a thing (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">interdico, veto): tu modo ne me prohibeas accipere, siquid det mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo hic prohibet nec vetat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex recta imperans prohibensque contraria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:14:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 14, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed dii et homines prohibuere redemptos vivere Romanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:49:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 49, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:104" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 104</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenis affectus movere per praeconem prohibebatur orator,</quote> <trans><tr>the orator was forbidden</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prohibitis abstinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 83, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38684.11" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To keep away</hi> from a thing for the sake of safety (cf. defendo, II.), <hi rend="ital">to keep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protect</hi> (rare but class.); with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo periculo prohibete rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adultam virginem ab armatorum impetu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:96:330" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 96, 330</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec damna multa mulierum Me uxore prohibent,</quote> <trans><tr>keep me from a wife</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum civium numerum calamitate prohibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuiores injuriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad prohibendam populationibus Campaniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 14, 2</bibl></cit>.—With double <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id te Juppiter Prohibessit,</quote> <trans><tr>from that may Jupiter preserve you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prohibitio: <entryFree id="n38685" type="main" key="pro^hi^bi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏhĭbĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prohibeo</etym>. <sense id="n38685.0" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a hindering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preventing</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:42:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 3, 42, § 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38685.1" n="B" level="2"> In partic., a legal hindering, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a forbidding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prohibition</hi> (very rare, but class.): sceleris, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tollendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:14:section=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 14, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus actus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divortii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Monog. 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prohibitor: <entryFree id="n38686" type="main" key="pro^hi^bi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏhĭbĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a withholder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrainer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preventer</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">valetudinum pessimarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 249</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 12, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24, 4, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 52 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
prohibitorius: <entryFree id="n38687" type="main" key="pro^hi^bi^to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏhĭbĭtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>prohibitor</etym>, <sense id="n38687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">restraining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prohibitory</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">avis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that restrains from an act by unfavorable omens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 14, 17, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interdictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:26:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 26, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:140" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 140</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Par. 1, 5, 26</bibl>. <cb n="PROI" /></sense></entryFree>
prohibitus: <entryFree id="n38688" type="main" key="pro^hi^bi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏhĭbĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from prohibeo.</entryFree>
prohinc: <entryFree id="n38689" type="main" key="pro^hinc"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏ-hinc</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n38689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on this account</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 133, 3</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl>, p. 159, 41; 11, p. 270, 40.</sense></entryFree>
proicio: <entryFree id="n38690" type="main" key="pro_i^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-ĭcĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">projĭcĭo</orth>), <itype>jēci, jectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>jacio</etym>. <sense id="n38690.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38690.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to throw forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">before; to fling away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw down; to throw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thrust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">put out; to stretch out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi>: projectum odoraris cibum, <hi rend="ital">thrown before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to you</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:6:10" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 6, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frusto cibarii panis ei projecto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 177, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadavera projecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=25" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 25</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">crates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquilam intra vallum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum in mediā Libyā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in ignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">geminos cestus in medium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 402</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela manu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 835</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma, of one in flight (cf.: abicere arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 2, 4</bibl></cit>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Alex. 76" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Alex. 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus projectis fugae consilium capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insepultos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:21:3:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 21, 3, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diogenes proici se jussit inhumatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:43:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 43, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvam,</quote> <trans><tr>to cast out</tr>, <tr>expose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus,</quote> <trans><tr>to stretch out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:141" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastam,</quote> <trans><tr>to hold out</tr>, <tr>extend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strato graves artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:141" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 141</bibl></cit>: scutum, <hi rend="ital">to hold in front</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to oppose</hi>, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">projecto prae se clipeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proicere se ad pedes alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 11, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad genua alicujus se proicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:32:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 32, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ex navi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se super exanimem amicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 444</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">projecturus semet in flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:219" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 219</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38690.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38690.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cast out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expel; to exile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantam pestem evomere et proicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in exilium proici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 3:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ab urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:504" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 504</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix duo projecto (mihi) tulistis opem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agrippam in insulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a facie tuā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:50:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 50, 12</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n38690.4" n="2" level="3"> In architecture, <hi rend="ital">to let</hi> any part of a building <hi rend="ital">jut out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to project</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:4:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus immittendi tigna in parietem vicini, proiciendi, protegendi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38690.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38690.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To throw away</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yield</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renounce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disdain</hi>, etc. (cf. depono): <cit><quote lang="la">nec pro his libertatem, sed pro libertate haec proicias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 12, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriam virtutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem salutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ampullas et sesquipedalia verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:544" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 544</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatūs auctoritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem,</quote> <trans><tr>to deprive one's self of the light of day</tr>, <tr>to blind one's self</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:237" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 237</bibl></cit>.—Esp. of life: <cit><quote lang="la">animas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 436</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 526</bibl></cit>.—With personal objects: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to neglect</tr>, <tr>desert</tr>, <tr>forsake</tr>, <tr>abandon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:32:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 32, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 10, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38690.7" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rush into</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">si qui se in hoc judicium forte projecerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 9, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38690.8" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38690.9" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To rush into danger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulae tuae monent et rogant, ne me proiciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non integrā re, sed certe minus infractā, quam si una projeceris te,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 10, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in miserias projectus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38690.10" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To degrade one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in muliebres et inutiles fletus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:37:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 37, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38690.11" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To obtrude itself</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae libido non se proripiet ac proiciet occultatione propositā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38690.12" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To put off</hi> as to time, <hi rend="ital">to defer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delay</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quantum odii fore ab iis qui ultra quinquennium proiciantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 36</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prōjectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n38690.13" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">stretched out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jutting out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">projecting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs projecta in altum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:10:section=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 10, § 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">projecta saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:699" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 699</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 20</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">insula a septentrione in meridiem projecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 6, 12, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventre projecto,</quote> <trans><tr>projecting</tr>, <tr>prominent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 51</bibl></cit>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventre paulo projectiore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n38690.14" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-jectum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a jutty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">projection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">projecture</hi> in a building, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:242" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 242</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:17:6" default="NO">43, 17, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:24:22" default="NO">43, 24, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38690.15" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38690.16" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Prominent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">projecta atque eminens audacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:65:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 65, 183</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:7:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 7, 11</bibl> (from <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 373, 25</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 44, 115</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38690.17" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Inclined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">addicted</hi> to any thing, <hi rend="ital">immoderate</hi> in any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">homo ad audendum projectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:1:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines in verba projecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 20</bibl></cit>: in libidinem, <pb n="1462" /> <cb n="PROJ" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 3, 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">projectissima ad libidinem gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38690.18" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Thrown away;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">abject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">base</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemptible</hi>, = abjectus, contemptus: <cit><quote lang="la">non esse projectum consulare imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">projecta patientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 65 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">projectā vilior algā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 42</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: quid esse vobis aestimem projectius? Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 153.—</sense><sense id="n38690.19" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Downcast</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus projectus et degener,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 65</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-jectē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">carelessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indifferently</hi> (post-class.): <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proin: <entryFree id="n38691" type="main" key="pro^in"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏin</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. proinde.</entryFree>
proinde: <entryFree id="n38692" type="main" key="pro^inde_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏ-indē</orth> (abbrev. <orth extent="full" lang="la">proin</orth>, like dein for deinde; <sense id="n38692.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">usually monosyl.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 155</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. prol. 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 20</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">dissyl.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:20:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 20, 16</bibl></cit>), <pos>adv.</pos> </sense><sense id="n38692.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Just so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the same manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in like manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just</hi>, <hi rend="ital">even;</hi> usually with a foll. <hi rend="ital">atque</hi> (<hi rend="ital">ac</hi>), <hi rend="ital">quasi</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, rarely <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi nunc, proinde ac merere, summas habeo gratias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 2, 6</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipiades ... Ossa dedit terrae, proinde ac famul infimus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1035" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1035</bibl></cit>; so, proinde atque (ac) si, Lex Rubr. lin. 17, ap. Haubold, Monum. Leg. p. 146; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quā de re quoniam nihil ad me scribis, proinde habebo ac si scripsisses nihil esse,</quote> <trans><tr>just as if</tr>, <tr>the same as if</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde aestimans, ac si usus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde expiscare quasi non nosses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde quasi nemo siet, Ita, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 5, 9</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde quasi nostram ipsam mentem videre possimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:31:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 31, 84</bibl></cit>;
