and: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde quasi aut plures fortunati sint quam infelices, aut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:36:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 36, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec curata sint Fac sis, proinde adeo, ut me velle intellegis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciam, sit, proinde ut dixi, Tragicomoedia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> prol. 63: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde ut commodumst et lubet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde ut quisque fortunā utitur, ita praecellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, in the reverse order: quia, ut vos mihi domi eritis proinde ego ero fama foris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:648" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 648</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si proinde amentur mulieres diu quam lavant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: equidem diis habeo gratiam, non proinde quia natus est quam, etc. (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ou)x ou(/tws ... w(s</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:3:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 3, 5</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: hunc filii loco non proinde habere turpe mihi videtur, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 24, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, sive dulcis esset sapor uvae sive acidus, proinde aestimarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:68" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 3, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38692.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Hence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">therefore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accordingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">then</hi>, in expressions of advice, exhortation, encouragement, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde actutum istuc quid sit quod scire expetis eloquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde istud facias ipse, quod faciamus nobis suades,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde hinc vos amolimini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: proinde aperte dice, quid sit, quod times, Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=229" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 229</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 63 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">proin tu fac, apud te ut sies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:And. 2:4:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> And. 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde aut exeant aut quiescant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde parati intentique essent signo dato Romanos invadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 49:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 49, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:83:1" default="NO" valid="yes">83, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde tona eloquio, solitum tibi!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde ne gravarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:5:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:7:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 31, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 19, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
projecte: <entryFree id="n38693" type="main" key="pro_jecte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōjectē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. proicio, <sense id="n38693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
projecticius: <entryFree id="n38694" type="main" key="pro_jecti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōjectīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>proicio</etym>, <sense id="n38694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cast out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exposed</hi> (ante- and postclass.). </sense><sense id="n38694.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. Argum. Cist. 8.—</sense><sense id="n38694.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Palladius projecticius,</quote> <trans><tr>rejected</tr>, <tr>despised</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 6, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
projectio: <entryFree id="n38695" type="main" key="pro_jecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōjectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a throwing forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stretching out.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38695.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: brachii, i e. <hi rend="ital">extension</hi> (opp. contractio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 18, 59</bibl>: projectiones aquae, <hi rend="ital">jets</hi>, Fest. s. v. tullios, p. 352 Müll.—</sense><sense id="n38695.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., like projectura, <hi rend="ital">a projection</hi>, in buildings; <cit><quote lang="la">also,</quote> <trans><tr>the right to build a projection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:17:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 17, 3</bibl></cit>, §§ 5 and 6.</sense></entryFree>
projecto: <entryFree id="n38696" type="main" key="pro_jecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōjecto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n38696.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to drive forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive out</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">homines in aperta pericula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 5, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38696.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to reproach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accuse</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem probris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 38</bibl></cit>: ego projector quod tu peccas, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> Figur. Sent. p. 222</bibl> Ruhnk.</sense></entryFree>
projectorius: <entryFree id="n38697" type="main" key="pro_jecto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōjectōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ejecting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detergent</hi> (in later medicine): vis, Theod.<cb n="PROL" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Diaet. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba projectoriae virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0923,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>Aem. Mac.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
projectura: <entryFree id="n38698" type="main" key="pro_jectu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōjectūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>proicio</etym>, <sense id="n38698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a jutty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">projecture</hi> in buildings, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes">3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
projectus: <entryFree id="n38699" type="main" key="pro_jectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōjectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from proicio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38700" type="main" key="pro_jectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōjectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (only in <sense id="n38700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>proicio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a jutting out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">projecting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">projection</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:987" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 987</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 11, 19, § 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
projicio: <entryFree id="n38701" type="main" key="pro_ji^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-jĭcĭo</orth>, v. proicio.</entryFree>
prolabor: <entryFree id="n38702" type="main" key="pro_la_bor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-lābor</orth>, <itype>lapsus, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n38702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to glide forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to slide</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slip along</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fall down</hi> (class.; in Cic. most freq. in a trop. sense). </sense><sense id="n38702.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: at Canis ad caudam serpens prolabitur Argo, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 44, 114; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:47" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 47</bibl>: ruit prolapsa moles, of the sea, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:35:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 35, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">collapsus pons, usque alterius initium pontis prolabi eum leniter cogebat: alii elephanti pedibus insistentes, alii clunibus subsidentes prolabebantur,</quote> <trans><tr>to slide along ... slide forward</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 5</bibl></cit> sqq.: velut si prolapsus cecidisset, terram osculo contigit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus prolapsum per caput regem effudit,</quote> <trans><tr>falling down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex arbore altā prolapsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 45, § 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:223" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 223</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">prolapsus in cloacae foramen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prolapsa Pergama,</quote> <trans><tr>fallen down</tr>, <tr>fallen to ruin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:555" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 555</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Laodicea tremore terrae prolapsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38702.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38702.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To go forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to proceed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come</hi> to, <hi rend="ital">fall</hi> into any thing: me longius prolapsum esse, quam ratio vestri judicii postularit, <hi rend="ital">have gone farther</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">have said more</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:35:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 35, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libenter ad istam orationem tecum prolaberer,</quote> <trans><tr>would go on</tr>, <tr>be led on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:20:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 20, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in misericordiam prolapsus est animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rabiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad seditiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad jurgia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad superbiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 17</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38702.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To slip out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">escape</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quod ab aliquā cupiditate prolapsum verbum videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 13, 28</bibl></cit> (9, 18).—</sense><sense id="n38702.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To fall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">err</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">timore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 24, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 17, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditate regni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimio juvandi mortales studio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 29, § 118</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38702.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To fall to decay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go to ruin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc unius mulieris libido est prolapsa, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 20, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eo prolapsi sunt mores, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita prolapsa est (juventus), ut coërcenda sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad id prolapsae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquod dedecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prolapsum clade Romanum imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem temeritate ejus prolapsam restituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:19" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">studio magnificentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38702.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To fall away from grace</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 6, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prolapsio: <entryFree id="n38703" type="main" key="pro_lapsi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlapsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prolabor</etym>. <sense id="n38703.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A slipping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">falling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingredi sine casu aut prolapsione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:17:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 17, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38703.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A falling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tumbling down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificiorum prolapsiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38703.2" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an error</hi>, <hi rend="ital">misstep</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">intempestiva temeritas et prolapsio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; Ambros. de Noë, 14, 49; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Bon. Mort. 10, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prolapsus: <entryFree id="n38704" type="main" key="pro_lapsus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlapsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from prolabor.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38705" type="main" key="pro_lapsus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlapsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>prolabor</etym>, <sense id="n38705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a falling</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> Orig. Princip. 2, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prolatio: <entryFree id="n38706" type="main" key="pro_la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>profero</etym>. <sense id="n38706.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bringing forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">putting forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adducing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pronouncing</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <trans><tr>utterance</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbi intellegibilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:6" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Latinorum nominum prolatione, v. l. for pronuntiatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 13, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38706.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A setting forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mentioning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:34:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 34, 120</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38706.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A putting forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advancing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38706.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">finium,</quote> <trans><tr>extension</tr>, <tr>enlargement</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 20, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 30</bibl>; Hilar. Trin. 4, 3.—</sense><sense id="n38706.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A putting off</hi> as to time, <hi rend="ital">a deferring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delaying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">postponement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 32</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem prolationem suspectabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 82</bibl></cit>; so in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prolativus: <entryFree id="n38707" type="main" key="pro_la_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n38707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uttered</hi> (late Lat.): si quis insitum et prolativum verbum Dei filium dicat, anathema sit, Hilar. Synod. 45.</sense></entryFree>
prolato: <entryFree id="n38708" type="main" key="pro_la_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlāto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>profero</etym>. <sense id="n38708.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To lengthen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enlarge</hi> (not in Cic.; syn.: distendo, extendo; <cit><quote lang="la">profero, differo): agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem rusticam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, praef. § 19: effugium,<cb n="PROL" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:983" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 983</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam,</quote> <trans><tr>to prolong</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38708.1" n="II" level="1"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to put off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">postpone</hi> (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">profero, differo), id (malum) opprimi sustentando ac prolatando nullo pacto potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubitando et dies prolatando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 43:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 43, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem ex die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum indies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:61:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 61, 12</bibl></cit> Dietsch; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:142" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 142</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consultationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:48:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 48, 16</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil prolatandum ratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prolatando aliquantum extraxerant temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:2:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prolatus: <entryFree id="n38709" type="main" key="pro_la_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from profero.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n38710" type="main" key="pro_la_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>profero</etym>, <sense id="n38710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bringing forward</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prolectibilis: <entryFree id="n38711" type="hapax" key="pro_lecti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlectĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>prolicio</etym>, <sense id="n38711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">alluring</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 18</bibl> dub. (al. plectibilibus).</sense></entryFree>
prolecto: <entryFree id="n38712" type="main" key="pro_lecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlecto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to allure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">entice forth</hi> (cf.: illicio, invito). </sense><sense id="n38712.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimae redeunt, prolectante gaudio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 162, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mox prolectante studio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>, p. 159; <cit><quote lang="la">11, p. 259, 33: aviculae prolectatae verno vapore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit>, p. 260, 21.—</sense><sense id="n38712.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to allure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incite</hi> (rare but class.): egentes spe largitionis, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 8, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeda puellares animos prolectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:433" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 433</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus legentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam veneficiis ad nuptias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 331, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptialis gratiae nomine prolectatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 804</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38712.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To provoke</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiamne ultro tuis me prolectas probris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prolegatus: <entryFree id="n38713" type="gloss" key="pro_le_ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-lēgātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n38713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lieutenant-governor's substitute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a prolegate</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Maff.</author> Mus. Veron. 119, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Don.</author> 137, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prolepos: <entryFree id="n38714" type="gloss" key="prole^pos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pro-lĕpos</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n38714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a substitute for agreeableness</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prolepsis: <entryFree id="n38715" type="greek" key="pro^lepsis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏlepsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pro/lhyis</foreign>, in rhetoric, a mentioning a thing by a name which it has not yet received, <sense id="n38715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">anticipation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prolepsis</hi> (pure Lat. occupatio), <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 438</bibl> and 439 P.; <cit><quote lang="la">or an allusion to a thing as having happened before it has actually come to pass,</quote> <trans><tr>an anachronism</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:ad Cic. Verr. 1:45" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> ad Cic. Verr. 1, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">or a refuting of an objection by anticipation (written as Greek),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:16" default="NO">9, 2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proles: <entryFree id="n38716" type="main" key="pro_les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōles</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<sense id="n38716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> prolum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 301</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pro and root al- of alo, to nourish, whence olesco in ad-olesco, etc.; cf.: suboles, indoles</etym>. </sense><sense id="n38716.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that which grows forth;</hi> esp. of human beings, <hi rend="ital">offspring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">progeny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">child</hi>, <hi rend="ital">descendant;</hi> and collect., <hi rend="ital">descendants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">race</hi>, <hi rend="ital">progeny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">posterity</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">but cf.: nec fugerim dicere prolem, aut subolem aut effari, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:38:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 38, 153</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 26</bibl>, and <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr> the passages from Cic.; syn. progenies). —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">propagando procudere prolem,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring forth</tr>, <tr>produce children</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:856" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 856</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prolem est enixa gemellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudantur simili prole puerperae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">di Romulae genti date remque prolemque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et pulchrā faciat te prole parentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">felix prole parens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:384" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 384</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua postuma proles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:763" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 763</bibl></cit>: ferrea proles, <hi rend="ital">the iron race</hi>, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:159" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 159</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aënea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proles Ausonia,</quote> <trans><tr>the Ausonian race</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dic mihi, Teucrorum proles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:56" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 56</bibl></cit>.—In prose: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclara Brutorum atque Aemiliorum proles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 41, 2</bibl></cit> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:22:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 22, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proles illa futurorum hominum,</quote> <trans><tr>race</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 21, 23</bibl></cit>.—Of individuals (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Ulixi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Telemachus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proles tertia Phorcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 477</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clymeneïa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Phaëton</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollinea,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Æsculapius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:533" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 533</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deūm certissima proles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 322</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egomet Neptunia proles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:213" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 213</bibl></cit>.—Of deities: <cit><quote lang="la">Saturni altera proles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:830" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 830</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchi rustica proles,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Priapus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyllenia proles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulminis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Bacchus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:19:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 19, 35</bibl></cit>.—Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc nova proles per herbas Ludit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duellica equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 661</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam maris immensi prolem, genus omne natantum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 541</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 6, 7</bibl>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">et prolem tarde crescentis olivae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the fruit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: naturae contenta manu Zephyrique favore<pb n="1463" /> <cb n="PROL" />  Parturit (tellus), et tantā natorum prole superbit, Alan. Anti-<bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 1, 79</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: privignasque rogat proles, Col. poët. 10, 163.—</sense><sense id="n38716.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38716.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Youth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">young men</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sternitur Arcadiae proles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 429</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38716.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The testicles</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">polimina sunt ea, quae nos proles verecundius dicimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 230</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 172</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proletaneus: <entryFree id="n38717" type="main" key="pro_le_ta_neus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlētāneus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, i. q. proletarius, q. v.</entryFree>
proletarius: <entryFree id="n38718" type="main" key="pro_le_ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlētārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>proles</etym>. <sense id="n38718.0" n="I" level="1"> According to a division of the people by Servius Tullius, <hi rend="ital">a citizen of the lowest class</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who served the State not with his property</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but only with his children</hi> (proles), <hi rend="ital">a proletary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui aut non plus mille quingentum aeris aut omnino nihil in suum censum praeter caput attulissent, proletarios nominavit, ut ex iis quasi proles [id est quasi progenies] civitatis exspectari videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:22:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 22, 40</bibl></cit>; cf <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 43</bibl>; Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:10:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 10, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Enn. ib. (Ann. v. 189 Vahl.): proletarios lucrari plures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proletarium capite censum, dictum quod ex his civitas constet, quasi proles progenie: iidem et proletanei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=228" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 228</bibl></cit> Müll.—* </sense><sense id="n38718.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 157</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prolevo: <entryFree id="n38719" type="hapax" key="pro_le^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-lĕvo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to draw forth</hi>, trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem peccatorum fluctibus mersum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prolibo: <entryFree id="n38720" type="main" key="proli_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pro-lībo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pour out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offer as a libation</hi> to the gods (Plinian): <cit><quote lang="la">vina diis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 18, 22, § 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:119" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 19, 23, § 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:46" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 4, 11, § 46</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fictilibus prolibatur simpuviis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 46, § 158</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proliceo: <entryFree id="n38721" type="hapax" key="pro_li^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-lĭcĕo</orth>, <itype>cui, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>liqueo</etym>, <sense id="n38721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to run</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flow forth</hi>: prolicere, emanare, effluere. Varro: demum ubi prolicuit dulcis unda, Gloss. Isid.</sense></entryFree>
prolicio: <entryFree id="n38722" type="main" key="pro_li^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-lĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>lixi</itype> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 149</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>lacio</etym>, <sense id="n38722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to allure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">entice forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to entice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incite</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post - Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">ejus amos cupidam me huc prolicit per tenebras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas tardā prolicienda morā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:718" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 718</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 73 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
prolicito: <entryFree id="n38723" type="gloss" key="prolicito"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prolicito</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. ‡ procitare.</entryFree>
prolimen: <entryFree id="n38724" type="main" key="pro_li_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-līmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n38724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a space before the threshold</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ezech. 12, 40, 8</bibl></sense></entryFree>
proliquatus: <entryFree id="n38725" type="main" key="pro_li^qua_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-lĭquātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [liquo], <sense id="n38725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">liquefied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">liquid</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 283, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prolixe: <entryFree id="n38726" type="main" key="pro_lixe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlixē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. prolixus <sense id="n38726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
prolixitas: <entryFree id="n38727" type="main" key="pro_lixi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlixĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prolixus</etym>. <sense id="n38727.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Great length</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breadth</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">width</hi>, <hi rend="ital">great extension</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">terrae, App. de Mundo, p. 60, 21: colubra prolixitatis immensae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporis,</quote> <trans><tr>length of time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:1:22" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 36, 1, 22</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n38727.1" n="2" level="3"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">prolixity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne forte prolixitas fastidium audientiae pariat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 2:8" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 2, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prolixitudo: <entryFree id="n38728" type="hapax" key="pro_lixi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlixĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prolixity</hi>, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 160, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prolixo: <entryFree id="n38729" type="hapax" key="pro_lixo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlixo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lengthen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem ferramenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prolixus: <entryFree id="n38730" type="main" key="pro_lixus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-lixus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>laxus</etym>, <sense id="n38730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stretched far out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">broad</hi> (syn.: latus, spatiosus). </sense><sense id="n38730.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">capillus passus prolixus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 49</bibl></cit> Umpfenb. (Fleck. prolixe): <cit><quote lang="la">comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:2:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 34</bibl></cit> (Forbig. promissa): <cit><quote lang="la">caudae (opp. breves),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:9:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:9:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">prolixo corpore erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 12</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arator prolixior,</quote> <trans><tr>taller</tr>, <tr>stouter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:9:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prolixiora quaedam nascuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:6:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38730.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38730.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extended</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">prolixae aetatis homines,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of great age</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:6:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 6, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">prolixioris temporis spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:14:45" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 49, 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tam prolixo provolat ictu,</quote> <trans><tr>far-reaching</tr>, <tr>distant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cognitio prolixiorem tractatum habeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:1:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 1, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor (with largus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1:57" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1, 57</bibl></cit> Mai.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">prolixum ejulare,</quote> <trans><tr>greatly</tr>, <tr>violently</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 205, 15</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n38730.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n38730.5" n="1" level="3"> in speech, <hi rend="ital">prolix</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cujus exemplum, ne sim prolixus, omisi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n38730.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Comprehensive</hi> in meaning (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">existimo longe esse amplius, prolixius, fusius in significandā totius prope civitatis multitudine mortales quam homines dixisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:28:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 28, 3</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n38730.7" n="3" level="3"> Of circumstances, <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi>, <cb n="PROL" /> <hi rend="ital">fortunate</hi> (class.): rebus secundis atque prolixis atque prosperis, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera spero prolixa esse his duntaxat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38730.8" n="4" level="3"> Of disposition and conduct, <hi rend="ital">well-disposed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obliging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courteous</hi> (Ciceron.): <cit><quote lang="la">prolixa beneficaque natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus libens et prolixus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, C, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">Ariobarzanes in Pompeium prolixior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-lixē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">largely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copiously</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">capillus passus prolixe et circum caput Rejectus neglegenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 49</bibl></cit> Fleck. (Umpfenb. passus prolixus): <cit><quote lang="la">prolixe cumulateque facere aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 36, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prolixe et celeriter facere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, A, § <cit><quote lang="la">6: prolixe fuseque laudare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo (delectu) parum prolixe respondent Campani coloni,</quote> <trans><tr>do not announce themselves in very great numbers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores prolixe foliatae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 143, 15</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">largius prolixiusque fruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:22:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 22, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabulari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipit hominem prolixius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fovere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et factus in agoniā, prolixius orabat,</quote> <trans><tr>more earnestly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:22:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 22, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
prolocutio: <entryFree id="n38731" type="main" key="pro_lo^cu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlŏcūtĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-quūtĭo</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>proloquor</etym>, <sense id="n38731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a preamble</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prolocutor: <entryFree id="n38732" type="hapax" key="pro_lo^cu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlŏcūtor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">prolŏqu-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pleader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advocate</hi>, Auct. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. Trib. Marian. 3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. Trib. Marian. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prologium: <entryFree id="n38733" type="greek" key="pro^lo^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏlŏgĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">prolo/gion</foreign>, <sense id="n38733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a preface</hi>, <hi rend="ital">introduction</hi>: prologium, principium, proloquium. Pacuvius: quid est? nam me exanimasti prologio tuo, Paul. ex Fest. p 226 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
prologus: <entryFree id="n38734" type="greek" key="prolo^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prolŏgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pro/logos</foreign>. <sense id="n38734.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a preface</hi> or <hi rend="ital">introduction to a play</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a prologue</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in prologis scribundis operā abutitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. prol. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Hydriae (Menandri) prologo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:91" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in prologo Adelphorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:Ter. 2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. Ter. 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38734.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the player who delivers the prologue</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratorem esse voluit me, non prologum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 11</bibl></cit>; id. Hec. prol. alt. 1 (prō-, v. Wagn. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 11</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
prolongo: <entryFree id="n38735" type="main" key="prolongo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prolongo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n38735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v.</hi> [pro-longus], <hi rend="ital">to lengthen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prolong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi> (late Lat. for prorogo, profero, duco): <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniquitatem suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:128:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 128, 3</bibl></cit>; Hilar. ad loc.; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Psa. 119, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 9:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 12, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proloquium: <entryFree id="n38736" type="main" key="pro_lo^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlŏquĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>proloquor</etym>. * <sense id="n38736.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An introduction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preamble</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=226" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 226</bibl> Müll.; v. prologium.—</sense><sense id="n38736.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An assertion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">axiom</hi> (class. Lat. pronunciatum), the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)ci/wma</foreign>, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:8:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 8, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 29, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">disjunctivum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:11:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 11, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38736.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A judicial sentence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub uno proloquio cunctos jubet occidi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">28, 1, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proloquor: <entryFree id="n38737" type="main" key="pro_lo^quor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-lŏquor</orth>, <itype>cūtus</itype> (quūtus), 3, <sense id="n38737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38737.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to speak out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">say</hi> (mostly ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">not found in Cic., Cæs., or Quint.): prolocutum (dicimus), cum animo quod habuit, extulit loquendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=56" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 56</bibl></cit> Müll.: hoc profiteri et proloqui advorsum illam, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 232, 24</bibl> (Trag. v. 384 Vahl.): miserias Medeai caelo atque terrae, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 26, 63</bibl> (Trag. v. 291 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">cogitata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 5, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">proloqui quicquam verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. prol. 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervagatissimus ille versus, qui vetat Artem pudere proloqui quam factites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:43:147" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 43, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc quam rem oratum huc veni, primum proloquar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 50</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">interrog.-clause</hi>: quid sentiatis proloquimini, Auct. B. Afr. 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 2, 13</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut occepisti, perge porro proloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 125</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n38737.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to foretell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predict</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proloquar, atque utinam patriae sim vanus haruspex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 13</bibl></cit> (4, 12), 59.</sense></entryFree>
proloquutor: <entryFree id="n38738" type="main" key="pro_lo^quu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlŏquūtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, v. prolocutor.</entryFree>
proloquutus: <entryFree id="n38739" type="main" key="pro_lo^quu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlŏquūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from proloquor.</entryFree>
prolubido: <entryFree id="n38740" type="gloss" key="pro_lu^bi_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-lŭbīdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n38740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclination</hi>: prolubium (al. prolubiem) et prolubidinem dici ab eo quod lubeat, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 64, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prolubium: <entryFree id="n38741" type="main" key="pro_lu^bi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-lŭbĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>lubet</etym>. <sense id="n38741.0" n="I" level="1"> Subject.,<cb n="PROM" />  <hi rend="ital">will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclination</hi> (ante- and post-class.): muliebre ingenium, prolubium, occasio, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 64, 8</bibl>; Novat. and <bibl default="NO"><author>Laber.</author> ib. 10</bibl> and 12; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:19:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 19, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38741.1" n="II" level="1"> Object., <hi rend="ital">pleasure</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">majus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:10:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 10, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 249, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proluceo: <entryFree id="n38742" type="hapax" key="pro_lu_ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-lūcĕo</orth>, <itype>xi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n38742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shine forth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ot. Sap. 5:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ot. Sap. 5, 4</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Beat. 32</bibl>; Haase, perducens).</sense></entryFree>
proludium: <entryFree id="n38743" type="main" key="pro_lu_di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlūdĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>proludo</etym>, <sense id="n38743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">preliminary exercise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">training</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum quasi in proludiis negotium spectaretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cotidiana proludia exercitūs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinae castrensis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 5, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proludo: <entryFree id="n38744" type="main" key="pro_lu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-lūdo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n38744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to play</hi> or <hi rend="ital">practise beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prelude.</hi> </sense><sense id="n38744.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">et sparsā ad pugnam proludit harenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 234</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic ubi prolusit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 515</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:22:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 22, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38744.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: sententiis, quibus proluserint, <hi rend="ital">which served them for previous exercise</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:80:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 80, 325</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurgia proludunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:26" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per has mortalis aevi moras illi meliori vitae longiorique proluditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 102:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 102, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum per ista prolusum est, crescunt maria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:28:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 3, 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima per legatos habita certamina, cum hinc Domitius et Thorius, inde Hirtulei proluderent,</quote> <trans><tr>opened the contest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:22:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 22, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prolusit dolor per ista noster,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 907" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 907</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1061" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Hippol. 1061</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 221" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Fur. 221</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prolugeo: <entryFree id="n38745" type="gloss" key="pro_lu_ge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-lūgĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n38745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to mourn greatly</hi>: prolugere dicuntur qui solito diutius lugent, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=226" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 226</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
proluo: <entryFree id="n38746" type="main" key="pro_lu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-lŭo</orth>, <itype>lŭi, lūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n38746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wash forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cast out</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose; not found in Cic.; once in Cæs.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>). </sense><sense id="n38746.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus omne natantum Litore in extremo ... fluctus Proluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 543</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">ventrem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to cause diarrhœa</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:25" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38746.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n38746.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To wash off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas ex omnibus montibus nives proluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetus aquarum proluit terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:18:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 18, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">silvas Eridanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 481</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:686" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 686</bibl>.—Hence, * </sense><sense id="n38746.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make away with</hi> property: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam prandiorum gurgitibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to squander</tr>, <tr>dissipate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:24:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 24, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n38746.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To moisten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wash</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vivo prolue rore manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:778" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 778</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with blood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:304" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 304</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruor proluit pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:711" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 711</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of drinking: <cit><quote lang="la">leni praecordia mulso Prolueris melius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se pleno auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:739" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 739</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">multā prolutus vappā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec fonte labra prolui caballino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:prol. 1" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> prol. 1</bibl></cit>.—In comic lang.: cloacam (i. e. ventrem), <hi rend="ital">to wash out the stomach</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to drink one's fill</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n38746.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To overflow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inundate</hi> (postclass.): prolutas esse regiones imbribus, App. de Mundo, p. 73, 26.</sense></entryFree>
prolusio: <entryFree id="n38747" type="main" key="pro_lu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>proludo</etym>, <sense id="n38747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prelude</hi>, transf., <hi rend="ital">a preliminary exercise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">essay</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:80:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 80, 325</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:14:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14, 47</bibl></sense></entryFree>
prolusorius: <entryFree id="n38748" type="main" key="pro_lu_so_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlūsōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v perlusorius.</entryFree>
prolutus: <entryFree id="n38749" type="main" key="pro_lu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from proluo.</entryFree>
proluvies: <entryFree id="n38750" type="main" key="pro_lu^vi^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlŭvĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>proluo</etym>, <sense id="n38750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an overflow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inundation</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Romae et maxime Appia ad Martis mira proluvies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 7, 1</bibl></cit> (Bait.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:950" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 950</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>filth cast forth</tr>, <tr>excrements</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1200</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:7:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:38:1" default="NO">12, 38, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedissima ventris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 217</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
proluvio: <entryFree id="n38751" type="hapax" key="pro_lu^vi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlŭvĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n38751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inundation</hi>, App. de Mundo, p. 73, 33.</sense></entryFree>
proluviosus: <entryFree id="n38752" type="hapax" key="pro_lu^vi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlŭvĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>proluvio</etym>, <sense id="n38752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">overflowing</hi>: pestis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">spreading in all directions</hi>, Auct. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> p. 564, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
proluvium: <entryFree id="n38753" type="main" key="pro_lu^vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōlŭvĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>prolus</etym>, <sense id="n38753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an overflow;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">an excess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">castitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Virg. 1, 4, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">proluvium, profusio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 373</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 28</bibl> (Umpfenb. and Fleck. prolubium); id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 3, 217</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
prolytae: <entryFree id="n38754" type="greek" key="pro^ly^tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prŏlytae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">prolu/tai</foreign>, <sense id="n38754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">jurists who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after studying five years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">were dismissed by their instructors with credit</hi>, Dig. praef. § 5.</sense></entryFree>
promagister: <entryFree id="n38755" type="gloss" key="pro_ma^gister"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-măgister</orth>, <itype>tri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n38755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who presides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rules</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">in the place of another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vice-president</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vicegerent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vice-director</hi> (in class. Lat. pro magistro), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 442, 49</bibl>; Inscr Grut. 426, 5; 607, 1 al.</sense></entryFree>
promagisterium: <entryFree id="n38756" type="gloss" key="pro_ma^giste^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prōmăgistĕrĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pro-ma gister</etym>, <sense id="n38756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of a</hi> promagister, <hi rend="ital">a vice</hi> <pb n="1464" /> <cb n="PROM" /> <hi rend="ital">presidency</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lieutenancy</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 173, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
promagistratus: <entryFree id="n38757" type="gloss" key="pro_ma^gistra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prō-măgistrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n38757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">administration by a substitute</hi> or <hi rend="ital">deputy</hi>, S. C. de Bacchan.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 629 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 582, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
